You can edit images immediately without in-app purchases or subscriptions. Our presets craft unique photo looks, offering everything from quiet muted tones to vibrant saturated colors. Unleash your creativity with our expansive photography filters collection.

Camera: A camera app with built-in GIF maker and effects
A new way to create is just a swipe and a tap away for all your photography. Our Camera feature has four camera options: Burst, Retro, Prism, and DSCO, designed to enhance your creative photo capture.

Collage: Craft photo collages in seconds! Rapidly create from pre-set templates or a blank canvas. Customize your one-of-a-kind composition with your photos and adjustable shapes, colors, and sizes. Perfect for photographers to present their work.

Dodge & Burn: Flawlessly perfect highlights & shadows. VSCO’s Dodge and Burn tool empowers creators to expertly shape light, flawlessly correcting common problems and skillfully guiding the eye to the image's focal point, precisely like a traditional darkroom.

VSCO Spaces: Seamlessly share galleries, receive feedback, and enhance your creative process. Spaces are collaborative environments that provide a safe space for creators to workshop ideas, share photography inspiration, and connect through collective galleries. Engage with our creative photo community, designed for photographers.

VSCO MEMBERSHIP
Start your VSCO Membership with a free 7-day trial. After your trial, your annual subscription seamlessly begins. Your VSCO Membership continues automatically. Manage your subscription with ease. Easily cancel your trial before it ends. For assistance or any questions, simply visit vs.co/help to submit a ticket.

Plans for all photographers
Invest in your creativity with VSCO Membership. Join our global community of photographers and creators today.

STARTER (FREE)
Explore your creativity and the VSCO community.
Essential set of editing tools and presets
Post your work to build your personal profile
Collect inspiration from our creative community
PLUS
Discover your creativity and share your photography.
Enhance photos with 200+ presets & advanced mobile tools. Showcase identity brilliantly: Craft your member profile. Enjoy full access to community Spaces & Discussions. Explore our detailed Terms and Conditions https://vsco.co/about/terms_of_use and clear Privacy Policy https://vsco.co/about/privacy_policy.
summary: Join our digital photography community with 15M+ users: Photo editing & filters

scraped_reviews.content: Used VSCO for YEARS! was the only photo editing app I would constantly come back to and love. however, they put basic editing tools behind a pay wall. puts a bad taste in my mouth. lost a customer. I have bought many preset filters from them and intended on continuing to do so. I'm not going to pay any amount of money to put a GRAIN on my pictures. seeing many other users saying the same thing. very sad. do better VSCO...

Would love to give an actual review of this, but the app is completely gated off behind a paywall. Even the free 7 day trial is not available without credit card info, which is obviously a ploy to make you pay if you don't cancel in time or making it very hard to cancel at all. Judging by all the reviews on here that had exactly that happen, I'm glad I deinstalled immediately. I don't buy something I have literally not seen, especially with so many amazing free apps available.

Be very careful when trying to sign up for the free trial - I don't remember exactly what I clicked, but I ended up paying for a monthlong subscription while trying to do the trial. I can't go back and check (since my unwanted subscription is still active), but I'm guessing the app is purposely designed to trick you. (I've already deleted the app, so if anyone on your support team can give me my 8 bucks back, I'll increase my rating to three stars. Obviously not holding my breath there.)

I would rate lower, if there was an option to do so! I got this app because I heard great things about it! Had for a few months paid the $19.99 and I can't even use anything within the app without it saying it costs, why is this happening?? Need this resolved or I want my money back, this is ridiculous when you pay for something and you can't even use it. Not a happy customer.

Right now we can't "copy edits" because you're pushing the membership and aren't letting the features work as usual. I see the developer has responded saying it's free to use. I know it usually is. Today there is a pop up that says "these features are also available in our membership" and when you try to click "continue without" it won't let you complete the action. But if you click join it works immediately.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Faith. Apologies for the confusion! The Copy edits feature is completely free to use. If you need any help using that feature, you can reach out to us at vs.co/help. We're here to help!

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for a while now and I absolutely loved it to edit photos for my website. However, lately the app has been crashing in the middle of me editing a picture. When I go to it and I try to edit again, it'll do the same thing over and over again. Also, if it does let me finish editing a picture when I go to save it, it just kicks me back to home and the unedited version is there, losing all of the work I did on the picture. It's ridiculous since I pay for this app.

Once again, the app is getting buggy out of now where. It was good for a while until the recent updates. I was hoping it'd be fixed but it hasn't. I would describe them but... There's so much. Images being duplicated, the same image being saved twice when I click to save one, random photos constantly being imported right when I open the app without me even inputting anything, etc.....

I used to really love this app. Couple oversights: 1) Android version: studio imported pictures don't show up if you move phones. And there is no way to do this manually. All the help files are garbage and a waste of time. I've wasted hours trying to figure it out. 2) I take thousands and thousands of photos. I usually edit in batch. The import feature doesn't let you scroll with a side bar to quickly navigate to the date. You have to tap tap tap scroll and see every single photo wasting time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the VSCO app. Please submit a support ticket at https://vsco.help/HelpCenter, so we could get you back to creating!

scraped_reviews.content: Love the high quality camera and the large selection of filters and editing features to make professional photos! However, when it comes to exporting my finished edits, there are many irritating technical difficulties. My camera roll receives the original photo before it was edited, rather than the finished edit. The deleting feature is fickle as well. When I select a photo to delete it, the thumbnail changes to another photo, and I get confused on what image I'm actually deleting. Please fix.

Used to love this app. I used to pay $20 per year for the premium subscription, and they raised itto $30/year or $7/month. You can no longer save your edits to your phone with the free version, which I think is crossing the line. I am canceling my membership and switching to the Lightroom app (which is FREE). There are plenty of other apps that can do exactly the same thing. Oh, and by the way, even when I did pay the $7/month my video edits wouldn't download to my phone. So, this is a scam.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with accessing certain presets and tools. We've made some updates which means some presets and tools are now part of our membership offering. Please check out our membership benefits https://vsco.help/MembershipFAQ. Thank you for creating with VSCO!

scraped_reviews.content: App sucks, just filters for editing, needed something for my business posts "hair". This is just a cheap knock off on Instagram. I messed up and didn't read the fine print when I downloaded and enrolled in a "free" trial which I believe was for 3 days and then got charged $20 ... totally my fault but save yourself the trouble. No refunds and NO way to contact support.

I love VSCO! I think it is such a freeing and creative platform that fosters growth with visual medias such as photos and videos. I love the design and simplicity of the app. It's very easy for anyone to use. I do have a few critiques. Sometimes it has a few glitches in it(ex: changing the thumbnail of photos while scrolling, distorting images if I don't allow location to be shown). In fact, when I choose to display location, it shows nothing about the location of the photo. Wish I could DSCO
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Michael. We’re sorry that you’re experiencing glitches on the app! Please reach out to our Support team at vs.co/help. We’re eager to resolve this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: Very user friendly. I can correct lighting and color slack on those "perfect" photos. Montage is so much fun to use. Wish there was draft saving for that and being able to add music and live stickers, but there are other apps for that. Not that big of a let down; I still use it on many photos and videos. One downside, it crashes a lot when using videos on montage and have to start over, or it will let you finish it, but it won't save or post it having start over anyway.

I've used the free version of VSCO for a few years now because it was the best option for photo editing; I didn't mind the ads or that certain features were locked because the interface was so user friendly. Now, however, there are suddenly paywalls on tons of features and presets that used to be free. Thing is, I wouldn't even mind paying if it was like this from the beginning. At this point, I'm just going to uninstall and move to another app; heck, I'll just edit in Instagram instead.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with accessing certain presets and tools. We've made some updates which means some presets and tools are now part of our membership offering. Your feedback has been forwarded to our Product team. Thank you for using VSCO. We apologize for this inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: I generally love VSCO as far as editing options for pictures. However, posting and saving is very buggy/touchy for me. It won't post the correct photo that I choose to upload. So weird! VSCO did not used to do this to me. Also, when in the studio, it'll display pictures in the wrong spot. And I just paid for the premium service for year #2, to find out it won't even post the correct photo anymore? If these issues are fixed, I'll take the review down, because I love it besides this.

This used to be my favorite photo editing app but they are taking away features that used to be free in order to force user's hands into paying for a premium subscription. It's really disheartening to see how greedy this app has gotten. Will be looking for a new photo editing app from this day forward. Shame on y'all! You really think during a recession ppl have extra money to spend on features that were free up until now? Features I used that were once free : adjusting tone, grain, etc. Boo! 🍅

Export issues... Whenever I export photos or videos and save to my phone they show as a black image. Most photos save as corrupted so I cannot use them! It seems to be when I edit in black and white more than colour, why? It's been 3 years since my last review saying the same thing and NOTHING has been fixed! Especially as the prices are increasing, again, this should not be an issue! Please fix asap!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Greetings - I’m sorry to hear you’re having trouble exporting media from VSCO. If you haven’t already, please be sure to update VSCO to the latest version. If you continue to have trouble reach out to us at https://vsco.help/HelpCenter

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using VSCO for a long time now and things have been great! But as of the past few days I can't upload any photos, and if any go through, it's only a couple. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling, logging out of my Google accounts, etc. Nothing works. I'm considering switching to another app since this one is no longer working.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Melissa. We're sorry that you’re experiencing an issue uploading your photos! Please reach out to our Support Team at vs.co/help. We’re eager to resolve this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: This is kind of limited in it's capabilities. If you're trying to put together a collage or something like that, it's probably fine. And it does have some movie editing capabilities. But if you're looking for true editing capabilities that drastically change the look of an image, this isn't what you want. Worth trying out with the free year of subscription I got as a Chromebook owner, but I already have these capabilities elsewhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your feedback about this feature. This may not be ideal for you and will be sure to communicate this with our teams here. Thank you so much for using VSCO and for continuing to be a valued member of our community.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used vsco for over 7 years and have absolutely loved it. However, they recently moved a bunch of previously free tools and filters (that I've used on a weekly basis for years) to premium only. Like really basic editing tools and my most used filter. I'm very frustrated and disappointed, as vsco has been my favorite photo editing app up until this point. Now there's hardly anything you can use for free. I will be finding another app to use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with accessing certain presets and tools. We've made some updates which means some presets and tools are now part of our membership offering. Your feedback has been forwarded to our Product team. Thank you for using VSCO. We apologize for this inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: Up until the past couple weeks, I'd give this app 4-5 stars. I rarely pay for upgraded versions of apps, but this one was worth it...until it wasn't. It started getting buggy--not uploading photos, crashing when trying to save, etc--and then just this past week it crashed and hasn't come back. I've done everything I can to try to fix it and it just will not open. Super frustrating, and even more so because it seems this is a broad issue and I've yet to see any plans for them to resolve it.

I loved all the filters and really wish I'd had more time to explore the app (the free week was great, I just happen to have a horrible cold). Ultimately, I couldn't commit to paying for a full year up front without knowing how much I'd end up using it, though I definitely would've signed up for another month at the monthly rate (which is given for informational purposes, but is not a payment option) had that choice been available to me.

I have used VSCO for roughly 4 years and have never had an issue...until now. My edits won't save the way I put them and it's driving me insane. I have used G3 on all of my photos set at 6.0 but recently when I save them, they automatically go all the way back up to 12.0 which ruins the way the photo looks and I am extremely frustrated. I have updated, uninstalled, and reinstalled and it's still happening.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Kasey! I'm sorry for the frustrating issue. Would you please reach out to our Support Team - http://vs.co/help? They will be able to troubleshoot this with you.

scraped_reviews.content: So far I've loved VSCO and as a professional graphic designer/photographer, I'd often turn to this app for some quick fixes due to how streamlined the UI is. That being said, for the past month or two, the app just doesn't work anymore. It crashes anytime I try and open it and won't upload photos, and often freezes my phone. Really disappointed. Hope this gets fixed soon.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Stephen. We’re sorry that the app is crashing for you! Please reach out to our Support Team at vs.co/help and mention your crashing experience. We're eager to resolve this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: The UI can be confusing and the entire layout can be hard of getting used to. The camera itself is very, very basic BUT does produce quality images when the lighting and everything in frame are perfect. And unless you're a paying subscriber, there just aren't enough features & filters offered overall. There's better apps out there with more to offer, for free...

Just last week most of the very basic tools were all free. I have had this app installed for over 2 years probably and I exclusively used it because it could add a nice grainy effect to my art. They've decided to lock a ridiculous amount if things behind a pay wall now. No thanks! Goodbye! I wouldn't recommend this photo editor anymore because a lot of nice tools are behind a pay wall now. Go look somewhere else! VSCO is not what it was.

I've been using and enjoying the app and my vsco membership for years. Since the last update, every time I try to edit a photo, it just shows a black screen. The tool bar is visible, but only export options work. Nothing in the Q&A worked. Reinstalling the app (after backing up my data) didn't work. I even connected to my PC and deleted the entire app folder and reinstall, still didn't work. Please fix this bug!!!! Update: bug fixed after a week, thanks!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. You're welcome! We're happy to hear you're able to edit again! Thank you for choosing VSCO.

scraped_reviews.content: It's okay. It's very discrimitive against Android users, like every other major app. It's glitchy or things don't load so I'll have to close the app then reopen it. I can't put up a profile picture, the photos won't load. Another thing is that I'll have to go into my gallery and share from there to upload a photo. Idk, if that's how it's supposed to be but I doubt it. The only thing I like about this app is that it doesn't lower the resolution of my photos, like Instagram does (badly).

This has been a 5star app for years upon years - so much so that I don't have the heart to give it only 1star. Practically my one stop shop for editing. But for the first time, today, importing photos not only made the app crash twice, but I can't see the thumbnail of edited photos. They are covered in a b&w or color static?? Please please please change this back.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Gibson. We’re sorry that the app is crashing for you! Please reach out to our Support Team at vs.co/help and mention your crashing experience. We're eager to resolve this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: I love and use this app all of the time! There is a large variety of filters to choose from and tools to use to improve and adjust the look of your photos. However, I am a little disappointed with the recent changes made to the app. I loved how you could swipe on the photo to undo and redo changes that you have made. It was extreamly helpful to compare the adjustments which in turn helped decide which change looked better. Hopefully a tool or shortcut similar to the old one will be added.

Great photo editing app overall. Free plan isn't too bad if you aren't picky. The UI is a bit unforgiving for me though; when browsing through my gallery, if I want to click on a picture and then go back to view more, VSCO automatically takes me back to the top of the gallery and then I'd have to scroll all the way down to view again. I also tried the free trial, which was short-lived. I gave my card info and confirmed when the free trial would end, but VSCO won't let me try the features. Weird

I've had this app for years and I've loved it for a long time. I had quite a few pictures i had edited that I was waiting to use and so i just left them in the app. When i went back into the app all the edited photos i had were gone. It sucks because i had some older photos saved on there and i would edit them a certain way. There's nothing i can do about it now :/

I've loved this app over all other photo editing apps until recently, and used it heavily. A couple weeks ago, it suddenly started crashing whenever I tried to edit a photo. I contacted customer support and got a lukewarm response with advice I had already tried. Even after uninstalling and reinstalling, it is still not functional. Now, it won't even upload a photo. Ugh. Will be cancelling my paid membership shortly and using another photo editing app if this is not fixed ASAP. Disappointing.

It's frustrating when a free app isn't up front with the fact that most of the features are locked unless you buy a membership. In about 5 minutes of setting up and looking through the app features I had 7 or 8 popups advertising the paid version or suggesting things it wanted me to do. If I had known up front that the features I was interested in were locked, I wouldn't have spent the time downloading and setting up an account.

Great app. Lots if free and cheap filters. Very good controls. Only complaint is lately if I'm editing photos using the "paste edits" option (awesome feature btw), it'll erase all the edits or some of them. Edit: this app has really fallen off. Sooo glitchy now and difficult to use. The only reason I keep using it is bc it does batch editing and none of the other photo apps I like do. Pleeeease fix the glitches...

This USED to be a great app. It was hard to believe it was free because it had so many great features, adjustable editing and filters and it was easy, functional, and smooth to use. Now you hardly have any options and they put a bunch of junk in your way that you can't even use to try and get you to buy it. Also not sure if your photos are private.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with accessing certain presets and tools. We've made some updates which means some presets and tools are now part of our membership offering. Your feedback has been forwarded to our Product team. Thank you for using VSCO. We apologize for this inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: I would rate this a 5 star app because I think it is the best on phone editing software I've used and it is a great non addictive or draining app. However there is a "tap here to unlock 7 days of vsco" dialogue box that you can't close (even if you were to try the trial). Has mad the app so annoying. The only way you don't see it is when you're editing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the app's design. If you'd like personal assistance with the app, please write in at https://vsco.help/HelpCenter. Our team will be happy to look into any issue you may be experiencing.

scraped_reviews.content: Seriously do not hesitate to download vsco. It is such an amazing tool to utilize if you are super into photography or just want to enhance your photos just a bit giving it more of that "wow" factor. You can download for free but do not have access to all the filters..I tried it out for a few days before buying it which was 19.99 for a year. GUYS!!!! Thats really not bad AT ALL for all the presets you have access to and all the tools you can use. I love photograpghy and vsco is my happy place.

This is a PAID FOR APP! Which is not clear in the description. I downloaded to check it out and then to get your account deleted is a 3 ring circus. There are too many free editing apps out there for casual users to pay for this. All of the photos showcased look the same btw. Same style, same editing. Not what I was looking for I guess.

The issue with the ability to either just edit and locally save your photos or edit and post online publicly has finally been resolved. The only issue I have is that it took over 3 months to resolve and I was not able to edit and save any photos without them. Forcefully being posted publicly online. That feature sucked when I was trying to edit dozens of private family events over the last few months. And even though I reached out to customer service dozens of times they offered no solutions.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the VSCO app. Please submit a support ticket at https://vsco.help/HelpCenter, so we could further assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for the longest time and I absolutely love it but for the past week I've been trying to edit my pictures and I have trouble importing them and when I finish editing a picture and save it to my camera roll an error always occurs and so I havent been able to save any of my edited pictures. I'm really getting annoyed and bothered by it. Please fix this :((

WARNING TO ANYONE INTERESTED IN THIS APP!!! I got it just to check out the features. It's fine until you decide the app isn't for you, then you're stuck going through this neverending process of verifying your account, attempting to get ahold of customer service (they make sure that's impossible to access btw), & once you think you finally got lucky completing the million steps to delete the account, the button for it won't work. The trial version will end, then stuck w/bill you never asked for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alicia - we're very sorry you've had trouble getting in touch with someone on the VSCO support team. Please submit a ticket on a desktop or laptop computer if you are having trouble signing in or verifying your VSCO account in the app. Contact us here: https://support.vsco.co

scraped_reviews.content: Don't want another media feed. VSCO has been great for tasteful image editing for years. Revisiting after a while, now it's trying to be a whole other social media feed with posting and way too much member sign up features. I wish it was more of the utility photo tool from "the good old days". I just want to edit a photo and save it to my phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the VSCO app. Please submit a support ticket at support.vsco.co, so we could further assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Previous review was 5 stars, now knocked down to 2. I receive an error every single time I try to save an image to my photos. And the exported frame rate for videos is so laggy that they are unplayable and distracting. What's going on? favorite app to edit photos in. straight and to the point. editing tools that dont compromise the quality of the photography. i tend to be happy with every update they release as well.

uninstalled..... I wanted to buy Pro because this seemed like a good app... as long as it didn't have all the advertising interrupting ones using the app.... but I will not subscribe to any software. that is a ridiculous expectation. paying for something for the rest of Life the rest of time, it's just not that good pal. subscription payments are synonymous with greed.... charging a subscription fee because you constantly have to update your software means it's an unfinished work.

I use to pay for the membership because it was such an awesome way to edit my photos; but lately it definitely hasn't been worth the money. It won't let me upload photos anymore unless I screenshot them before hand. My photos always disappear mid edit or when I try to save them all the editing I've done disappears. Sad, this use to be my favorite editing app. I hope someone comes up with a better app soon!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the VSCO app. If you haven't already, please update your app here: https://vs.co/update. If you're still experiencing issues after updating, please submit a Support Ticket at https://vs.co/help

scraped_reviews.content: Once a great app, now just a paywall absurdity. Overtime, otherwise fundamentally basic adjustments like "clarity" or even shadows/highlight tones requires purchase. It's only gotten worse, with more tools locked. In comparison it makes Adobe look like a Saint, with much less bloat (Lr/PS). The only thing VSCO had that was so robust were the filter packs, but you can certainly recreate them elsewhere. I've had & used this app for approx 6+ yrs as of writing so, take it as you wish.

I've been using VSCO as one of my main editing apps for years & now all of the sudden they are requiring you to be a member in order to access basic editing features that were previously included for free on the app. these are editing tools that you can find for free on almost every photo editing app out there. I have deleted my account now because it is not worth it to pay money for the bare minimum of editing tools. Very disappointed. I do highly recommend PicsArt though instead.

Use to be wonderful and now basically unusable. The import photo function does not show latest photos, and when you finally select the photos, it gets stuck on importing. You repeat the process until you spend 30 minutes just to import a couple of images. Saving also gets stuck, it literally crashes the app, says VSCO is not responding. As a paid member for years, this is beyond disappointing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there Susan. I would like to sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you. For updates on this issue, please visit vs.co/update. We'll update this page once the issue is resolved. Thank you for your patience!

scraped_reviews.content: I'm having a horrible experience right now. I've been using vsco for all my editing/photography and always shot in RAW and NEVER had a problem editing them on this app. Now all of a sudden I am having import issues and its really irritating because I pay a yearly subscription and haven't been able to edit my photos in over a month. Please fix this issue because I really enjoy VSCO!!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the VSCO app. Please submit a support ticket at support.vsco.co, so we could further assist you.

title: Google Tasks
description:
Stay on top of your to-dos with the Google Tasks mobile app. Easily capture, manage and get reminded about your tasks from anywhere, at any time. Your to-dos sync across all your devices, and integrations with Gmail and Google Tasks help you get tasks done— faster.

With Google Tasks,  you can:  
• View, create, edit, and manage tasks while you’re on the go 
• Stay organized by creating tasks lists for different topics or priorities
• Prioritize your tasks by using drag-and-drop to reorder them or by marking your most important tasks with a star 
• Track multi-step tasks with subtasks, helping you break down to-dos into smaller components 
• Set dates and get notifications  to ensure you complete tasks on time.
• Create tasks directly from emails in Gmail, with a convenient link back to the original message for easy reference

Learn more about Google Workspace: https://workspace.google.com/products/tasks/
Follow us for more:
X: https://x.com/googleworkspace
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/googleworkspace
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/googleworkspace/

scraped_reviews.content: This app went above and beyond to solve my problem with remembering to do stuff. I first had to just remember, which did not go well, then I would have to set alarms which were so loud. Then I got introduced to this app. It is amazing, sending silent notifications, while giving the option to repeat and set times. While being able to sort your tasks by categories. LOVE IT!! 11/10 for me, recommend!!!!

Good but just needs search bar... It gets pkaces on my calendar. Awesome! It sends notifications to my phone and I can add details. Also awesome! What's not awesome? Having dozens of tasks, trying to find ONE task that you want to modify delete etc and you have to SCROLL through all of it. Time consumer! Should be more like Google drive or keep. Search should be a simple thing to make this a 5 star app.

it's a great app, especially on desktop but the problem is that if you haven't opened the app for the day, you don't get the push notifications even though they're synced to your calendar. when I remove the app completely, I get push notifications from my calendar that stay until I mark them as completed. it's a shame, but I'll just keep using my gcal to add tasks 🤷‍♀️

Worthless for it's only job which is to remind you of tasks. When Android blocked apps from delivering full-screen notifications, they become less than garbage at reminding of things. I never missed any reminder before that change & now we get easily missed notifications that can be ¾ down a list of 40 other notifications & they don't stand out at all. A proper task reminder app should have some settings (this app has none) that allow for a full-scrren notification that is impossible to miss!

Overall, I really like this feature and use on my desktop for work all the time. I love having the app and can add on the go when I need to. You can turn an email into a task for later on, which is nice too. The only gripe I have is that if I set a date & time reminder, the reminder pops up once and then just disappears. No audible alert sound. No lasting pop-up or something on my Gmail inbox as an alert that it's still not completed unless I have the tasks view open. When busy you may miss it.

Outstanding from other task is the possiblity to view tasks in self-defined buckets on windows PC app. The syncronisation between PC device and Android phone works perfect. A big downfall is that the search for task has disappeared on android app... This must be returned to search for specific task by keyword, before creating it again... But also for finding a task from a long list for closing it. This is a very simple but essential feature!!! I would give 5 stars then!

Decent reminder and checklist app, integrated into Google Calendar. However, I REALLY wish it told me what time I marked a task as "completed". It could help users keep track of when medication was taken, which could differ from when the reminder was set. Please, please give me the option to see what time I checked off my tasks!

Would love a more customizable widget This app has gotten better over time but it's widget needs more customizing options. for example I place my icons vertically on the right side of my screen I'd love to then fill the other left side with a clear transparent version of the widget like Todoist offers. It lets me choose the theme, transparency and customize other elements. Otherwise it's a solid app and it's integration with Gemini and Google's apps and services is it's main advantage.

Google Task has been one of the most needed apps from Google and a lot of time. I used to do all my task keeping in Google Keep but it was lacking in different areas. separating the two has just made life easier. The reminders and integration with your daily calendar helps keep everything in order.

great app! However, I wish the app would keep my repeating tasks in the same order I set them as. For some reason, it set a different order the next day. I also wish that a task wouldn't pop up until the day it's set for. For instance, I like to do certain tasks on Monday. Thus, the task only pops up on Monday. And pops up on certain calendar date.

Amazing, only thing I would change would be customization options such as page color or font, but other than those superficial wants, genuinely perfect. I can create multiple lists for a variety of topics and it even saves completed tasks in case you need to go back and double check anything. Also links with your Google Calendar and will automatically add tasks from your calendar in whichever list. Plus, no ads! Perfect 10/10

Hard to say! it used to be just fine except for the never deleting anything, sometimes not hearing me right or not including what the reminder was about, or sometimes informing me too early or too late, but now it's done some switch with my new phone where it just doesn't alert me ever and apparently I have to reinstall it because apparently my phone doesn't acknowledge that I still have it?

it would be nice if notifications stayed active on your lock screen until completed, most times I find out I missed reminders I set because they're not on my lock screen and are past due, it shouldn't be hard to add a feature that keeps reminding you of tasks until you mark it as complete without having to keep checking the app. Otherwise it makes no difference whether I use this or just write it in my notes and keep checking the notes. Super frustrating to keep going to the Tasks app each time

Perfect for work! I use this app all the time to write down all the stuff I do throught my shift. I get to write detail issues with a work order number and a description of what I get done. I would wish there was a search function for all the work I've completed. I have them saved, BUT I have to scroll through 500 completed tasks. A search feature would definitely make this a 5/5

Lots of potential, long way to go. For very basic task tracking, this app can get the job done. However, the handling of subtasks and sorting is severely broken. If you sort by date, it will not respect task-to-subtask relationships and you end up with a huge mess. Additionally, notifications for tasks have become very hit or miss and regularly show up late or not at all. I really want to like this app, but I'm finding myself more and more frustrated with it.

I'm trying to avoid putting my checklists on scraps of paper. I've tried using either Calendar exclusively or Keep Notes. Both are good choices. But I don't need or want an integrated, highly functional tool for a simple list. Using my phone to enter a short to-do list is a lot more steps and time consuming than pen and paper. Is Tasks the sissors to concor my paper list, or is it a rock? Time will tell.

Painfully barebones. As with Keep, its only redeeming feature is that it has a small degree of compatibility with Google Assistant. All too often, time-based tasks will only deliver a notification up to two hours after they were due, even with unrestricted background battery permissions. Maybe instead of wanting to stick their AI-stained fingers into every possible pie, Google could try to do just one or two things well for once.

It's a great app to organize your daily routine tasks, work tasks, and any other type of tasks. I just hope Google adds the ability to track time on tasks, this will make google tasks greater and a full suite tasks tracker app. I tried couple of chrome extensions and apps from google workspace marketplace, but none of them worked properly with google tasks.

good app. biggest issue i tend to have is whenever i click something or delete anything, the toast notification comes up over my keyboard and prevents me from doing anything until it goes away. i have struggled with this inconvenience from seemingly day 1 and is probably my biggest gripe about using this app: forced 10s breaks for the notification to clear.

A nice basic to do list that works well with 'Hey Google' to easily add reminders. It doesn't seem to work well with Google Calender though. Some tasks that show within my calendar, aren't on my list when viewing tasks via the app, and when I click the tasks button within calender it doesn't display some items that the Task app will display so not something I can really rely on at this stage.

Reminder notifications are inconsistent. I'll use Gemini to create a 45 min reminder (and it creates it with the correct time) and then I'll get notified tomorrow morning for instance. I've checked all my battery settings to make sure it runs in the background but I still get occasional missed notifications for reminders and it is extremely frustrating. I'm at the point where I might switch to iPhone since I can't trust the most simplest functionality to work

this app is very very good at what it does, but lacks a lot of features: no way to view all your tasks from all lists at once, no search bar to find tasks, no granular integration with google calendar (if you want a certain list to not show on the calendar, there's no way to separate. it's all tasks or nothing). it also has a much buggier desktop version. while sync is nice, the website just isn't nearly as good as the app

Google Task is very good. it helps me take care of my tasks while I go on with my daily routine, I don't need to memorize task all the time, I just write it down and revisit them later. But I will suggest they add a search bar to quickly get to file without having to scroll through all the time.

Love how this syncs up to my calendar! I would love the ability to add location notifications like in Google Keep, and to be able to give each task group its own color, as well as having multiple day time frames for a task (like if I have three days to complete a task as opposed to it having to be done on a certain day), and the ability to tag someone... THAT is stil the one thing missing. I really wish I could tag/@ someone so it shows up on their calendar as well.

Reminders are very unreliable. If you give a command to set a reminder at 1pm tomorrow, it may or may not go off. It might go off at 3:30 in the morning, it might go off at 1pm the following day. I just got 2 reminders that were set for yesterday but only went off today. It's like this all the time. You might be thinking that maybe I didn't set it correctly, but anytime I've had this issue, I can see that it's set correctly.

I am in the process of renovating my house and I had been feeling totally overwhelmed by the huge list of to-dos I have, with all the different categories. Everything was on notes but that was draining me out even more. I downloaded 10+ different apps before chancing upon this one, and it's a total game changer. I absolutely love it! It's simple, clean, and clutter and ad free and everything is so well designed. There is a way to do everything. Just excellent!

Tasks works well for me. It has scope for a lot of complexity across lists and items with sub items. The one thing it still doesn't let me do is position/order my different lists as I like. A couple more years on: The biggest fault of an otherwise excellent app is that - unbelievably - it doesn't have a view for due / overdue tasks! If you miss the notification (limited in number) you can miss the task.

Pretty much a 5, I would like to finally see more sorting methods for the lists. Been sending mails like crazy for this. Other then that super great app Edit 14-02-2022 I do think the prior layout withe button layout in the bottom navbar was better. I see material design now puts the main action on the bottom right. The centered button was much easier to click, both for left and right handed people. 15-11-2025 latest update has bricked the android app. I can't do anything and get some error

As just a phone app, amazing! You can add tasks directly from it or the good old Google Calendar app, website. You can then see them listed in a widget or in the app. My gripe is why hasn't Google made it for it's Watch OS??!? They have a calendar app as well as their Keep app on it but not Tasks! It would be so cool if one could just see a tile on their watch listing the tasks and check them off there. Those preferring the keep app can still use it but give us the option to use this too.

Very underwhelming. I can create only one level of sub tasks and I have yet to get reminders to work or get tasks to sync across devices. It very well could be a lack of education on my part, but I am quite tech savvy and if these features exist they are not intuitive

For the longest time, I never used this bc I thought it never alerted me when tasks were due (other than displaying as a notification). Turns out I had made an error in the settings at some point and not enabled access to the Alarms/Reminders app. Now it works the way I would expect it to based on its functionality.

Excellent ad-free task application. I would like to request a QOL change to allow Tasks with subtasks to be repeatable, not just schedulable. It is less efficient to have to either remember to uncomplete the grouped task and reschedule the deadline or add multiple "tasks" for what is a compound task in practice. Thank you.

Google Task is a very useful and simple app for managing daily work & reminders. It helps me stay organized with my regular tasks, set reminders & complete work on time. The interface is clean, easy to use, and syncs well with Gmail and G Calendar. Prfct for anyone who wants a reliable task manager. Highly recommended! ✅ Suggestion: How can I search for a letter? If there is more than one task, is there any way to search for an any letter? So that it is known that this task is used a 2nd Time

Using it for my personal and professional tasks. There is no option for Assign Date and Deadline date, completion date options. So cannot track efficiency of task completion in timeline bound. Please add these features as it will add more value to users.

Google tasks is disappointingly lacking. It seems like the app developers are not in touch with the needs of customers. For instance, you can't add tasks to the bottom of the list by default, you'd have to manually order for every single task!

This is the most effective list making application I've found. You can create separate files for different activities. Like "Need to do Today", "Small Home Repairs", "Bills List". Then, you add your items to the file that's applicable. Or you can develop just one long list. It's simple, and works great. I love this application. Very effective tool.

It has good basic functionality. I often have to move my recurring tasks and it doesn't give the option to move the following recurring tasks. Also if I want to delete a recurring task, if I go from the list, it wants to delete all of those existing tasks but if I go from the calendar view, it gives options to delete just that one or that and following tasks.

This is yet another app that got "upgraded" (like the calculator) however got seriously ruined. I can no longer see what tasks are coming up further out on my phone. Which means I cannot confirm that a repeating task is actually scheduled. Because of this several tasks have ended up being duplicated while others go missing. I think there could have been improvements from the old one, but the mark was missed.

App is simple, but not intuitive. Lacks lots of features. You can't mass select and move selected into certain list or date. I love the looks of Google's apps but they really make them too simple at times.

Great app, does the job. It has been working great since the notification issue last year was fixed. 11/4/2025 - most recent updated disabled ability to change date for tasks, that is a HUGE setback for the app and makes it hard to use and nearly unusable on the phone. Not even sure how this could happen and an app to lose basic functionality but Google has been on a role with this lately with their apps so can't say I'm surprised.

If you'll add a feature of "my day" like Microsoft To Do - I'll switch to your service. And also no desktop web or app! That really sucks, it's inconvenient to use "inside" of other Google products.. Also no option to view all tasks. So unconvenient.

Bug: I can't update an existing task's date and time. The date picker and accounts switch settings, on top (overlayed) in the window, do not respond. You can undo completing a (completed) task, add details, repeat and add a list of sub-tasks on tasks — and arrange (sort) lists of tasks, by date (past/today/no date), starred ★/no star ☆, your order. You can create shared tasks in Chat/Docs and use them in the Google apps.

giving one star in hopes the team sees this. it is a good widget! but EVERY other Google app is color matched to a certain black and the task is the only app that isn't. thus if u have an android and use this as a widget it sticks out and looks bad. hoping they can change the default black to the rest of their eco system.

Very good app and should have an option 'mark as not complete' or some better word. The purpose is to mark those tasks which are skipped or not completed and also for a day wise result can be generated that how much percentage of a days tasks are completed and uncompleted. It will encourage a user to raise their percentage by completing more tasks on time day after day. Thanks

No annoying ads to block the progress. I've checked at least 20- 30 apps for adless experience. Look is professional. Sub tasks inside a main 'Things to Do' is a blessing. Simple, elegant and full of features keeping the true tradition of Google to give you a seamless experience with the annoyance. Thank you all at Google.

The notifications rarely actually send at the time I've signed the task. It varies between being hours early, hours late, or never notifying me. The only reason I see most of the tasks is because I'm constantly checking my calendar.

app is simple to use but has one annoying bug. If you complete a task before it's due it still shows up on my home screen. I'm running latest Android version on a pixel 7A in case anyone from Google wants to know.

Good app that I use everyday for all kinds of tasks! A couple of problems though: the widget is a little buggy (if it shows an upcoming task but I delete it beforehand, it will still show it until its previous due time) and the subtasks don't always work well, being moved in different spots in the list.

it's very useful, very light and a widget available, syncs across devices and tasks shows up in Google Calendar. Great!! Two requests, if the "details" section inside a task, can have bullet points structure & A search options for tasks among all the lists.

This app is very useful, but having to scroll through the type of lists created, at the top of the page is not efficient. It would be much better, if we could see the names of the list created, in a vertical format to select.

title: Amazon Kindle
description:
READ ANYTIME, ANYWHERE
On the bus, on your break, in your bed—never be without something to read. The Kindle app puts millions of books, magazines, newspapers, comics, and manga at your fingertips.

FIND YOUR NEXT GREAT READ
- Find your next great read with Kindle. Choose from millions of Kindle books (including books with Audible narration), magazines, audiobooks, and comics. Explore new releases, Amazon Charts best sellers, and titles across genres like romance, science fiction, children’s books, self-help, religion, nonfiction, and more—and try any book with a sample in the app before you buy on Amazon.com

- Kindle Unlimited members can enjoy unlimited reading and listening, with the freedom to explore over 1 million titles, thousands of audiobooks, and current magazines.

- Thousands of books, magazines, comics, and more included with Amazon Prime. 

GO BEYOND PAPER
Turn your phone or tablet into a book with the Kindle app—so you can read anytime, anywhere. Explore these reading features in the Kindle app:

- Read your way. Customize your text size, font type, margins, text alignment, and orientation (portrait or landscape)—and choose whether to turn pages from left to right or continuously scroll. Read comfortably day and night with adjustable brightness and background colors. Go to the Aa menu in your book to get started.

- Look up words, people, and places while you read. Breeze through words you don’t know and characters you can’t remember with the built-in dictionary, X-Ray, Wikipedia lookup, instant translations, and search within your book. Simply tap and hold a word to view its definition, or follow links to Google and Wikipedia to get more information.

- Track your reading progress. See what percent of the book you’ve read, real page numbers (for most top titles), and how much time you have left in the chapter or book based on your actual reading speed.

- Bookmark places you want to revisit, and make highlights and take notes throughout your book. Open My Notebook to see all your notes in the same place. 

- Hop, skim, and jump with Page Flip. Flip between pages or get a bird’s-eye view of your book with Page Flip—don’t worry, we’ll save your place.

- Zoom in on high-definition color images in Kindle books, magazines, comics, and manga.

- Sync your books across devices. When you’re reading a book, the Kindle app will automatically sync where you left off—along with any bookmarks, highlights, or notes—so you can start reading on one device and pick up where you left off on another.

- When you can’t read, listen. Switch seamlessly from reading your Kindle book to listening to the Audible book, all within the Kindle app.

- Get notified when authors you love have new releases.

By using this app, you  agree to Amazon’s Conditions of Use (www.amazon.com/conditionsofuse)  and Privacy Notice (www.amazon.com/privacy).

summary: Your library in your pocket. Anytime, anywhere.

scraped_reviews.content: I love to read and I love Kindle but since the book ordering format has changed, its less convenient. Also, my Kindle app has been stopping frequently and I have to close out and open again. I always have to re-download the book and a couple weeks ago, all my downloads disappeared. I had to uninstall and reinstall just for it to work. I'm not sure what happened but there seems to be an increase in "issues" so I cant gove it the 5 stars I want to.

I love reading Kindle books along with the audiobook books. The link between Kindle and Audible has been broken for months. I can't see the cost of audiobooks to pair up with Kindle books I own through the app anymore. And half the time when I try to play the audio in the app, I get the "assistive reader" thing instead of the audiobook. It ruins the reading experience.

This app used to be amazing with whisper sync. Now, it constantly glitches. I have to restart several times to get audio book to load. When it does, it's often back at the beginning of the book, and I have to hunt for where I left off. When it works, it's awesome & autostarts w the car. Mostly, it doesn't work. I have to stop the car, close the app, reopen the app at least 2x (it says book needs to be downloaded again), then find my spot. Generally, I can't stop, so can't listen. Frustrating!!!

I love the app but for some reason it just will not let you click on the "tap to download audible" link. It's basically just text. When you can sometimes get it to work, when you open the app the audible option doesn't always appear. You have to close it out and restart and clear cache and all that stuff. The integration with the audiobook could be better.

This seems the only way to show how disappointing it is that Amazon is now refusing to allow digital content downloads. I know I'm only a drop in the bucket, but I will no longer purchase any book for Kindle again and my hope, is to avoid with all possibility, purchasing anything through Amazon. When we pay for a product, even a digital one, we should have the right to read in whatever format we choose. This is greed, plain and simple. And it's wrong.

I love having my books with me wherever I go. I have had the app reset itself a couple of times where I had to re-add my books to my phone. Edit 3/3/2025.- I don't know what they have messed up on the app that has made their audible whisper sync so glitchy. I just bought a book yesterday with the audiobook (because I listen while I'm at work) I went to read it today and it is on chapter 1 saying it has 0 minutes left on the book. This isn’t the only book that has done this with.

Absolutely the best! I can download books to my library and read them from any of my devices, anywhere and anytime. I love having them available because often times we find ourselves in waiting situations we hadn't expected. Reading is a great way to pass the time. I homeschool my child, and having Kindle app helps me to have books readily available to read to my child on subjects we are learning.

Kindle is an excellent product for various reasons. Here's a few reasons I keep my subscription. 1.) Easy & immediate access to books to read or review before adding a hardcopy to your library. 2.) Handy & portable - like having a library & bookstore w/ 1000's of volumes at your fingertips. You can begin reading a new book from anywhere or continue your current read & picking up exactly where you left off - Kindle keeps your place for you! 3.) Saves trees!!!

I love that I can easily switch between reading and listening. It’s almost seamless. Why is the actual audio book and the assistive reader accessed the same way? Seemingly without a way to easily switch between the 2. I constantly have to open the app, close the app, then open it again to get to the audio book instead of the assistive reader.

Terrible problems with audible and whispersync . I've spent a LOT of money and their audible counterparts. Unfortunately the audible didn't work more than have the time. the option is there at the bottom of the screen when you tap on the page to bring irons up, but clicking the play button does nothing. or, assisting reader constantly pops up. I've spent literally thousands on this app, you'd think the biggest reading/audiobook app in the world would perform its basic functions.

I like how kindle is organized. It's easy to keep everything separated. They have a large inventory. Anything you want is easy to find. Also if you want to buy the books most of them is priced cheap. They have a lot of Boxsets. If you do the yearly subscription it's cheaper. Also if you want to cancel it's easy to do. They also have a free trial. If my review is any help will you please click on the helpful link below. Thank you.

Generally very good for reading books but the audible connection often doesn't work, which is really frustrating. I have downloaded the audible book several times to the Kindle app and it often doesn't show up. When I listen in the audible app, it often doesn't go to the place I'm at in kindle. They should have figured this out buy now since they're making double the money with people buying both the Kindle and audible versions of books.

I absolutely love this app! I can't imagine better. It's easy to use, financially sound, the wide array of selection is huge, and so much more! I also have the Kindle Unlimited subscription and it's worth it. All the books I've wanted to read are available within it without paying for them separately. Another comment - I thoroughly appreciate the boxed sets for many series. I read about 3 books a week, and all of the above make it possible, in such a fun journey!

Able to download app and log in on one device and no issues. On another device able to download app, but all sorts of issues. My collections have disappeared, but the books remain. Go to open a book and it gives and "ERROR: Unable to open." Attempted to contact support and all I got was AI telling me the things I've already tried to fix the issue.

I love Kindle and they've recently earned extra points for adding the "read aloud" feature. (About time they caught up to Play Books!) But I HATE that I am locked into their app. I like reading fiction on the Kindle app, but I like studying with a PDF format so that I can take notes and doodle in the margins. (This is more of an Amazon complaint than Kindle.) With this app, we don't actually own the books we purchase.

Amazing for ebooks, I love the sync with kindle. However if you buy both the ebook and the audio (what they call whispersync) it's terrible. The audio keeps bugging out. I have to uninstall and reinstall, and sometimes it works, most times it doesn't. The audible book alone is fine. The issue is sporadic but most of the time it doesn't work. When you pay $15 for a book and $15 for the audible narration to be attached, the fact that whispersync works so poorly is pretty unacceptable.

Really wish it auto-updated your GoodReads progress. At most it only marks as either reading or completed. However, besides that the app is perfect for on-the-go reading. You can also listen to audiobooks directly in the app and it highlights each word as the narrator speaks so you can keep track of the audio progress. For the most part, it's really good about syncing to where you left off on other devices, but every so often it's inaccurate. Also, I love that you can read offline too!

I am an avid reader/audio user. On average I read or listen to about 15 books a month. However, this app drives me insane!!! I don't know how many times in the last 3 days I have uninstalled and then reinstalled the app because the audio doesn't show up or won't download. If I pause it, the audio will disappear completely and then the cycle starts again. I use Kindle daily and it would be nice if they could get their act together.

I love Kindle but I didn't give 5 stars cause they never give subscribers a deal on kindle subscription. I get it but dang....sometimes I gotta pause it but I don't want to cause I love to read. would love to even send some stuff in I've already wrote in the past cause I'm just that intrigued in books and writing. but a deal could be done at some point for subscribers. just saying! Half off a month. or a bogo deal just for subscribers I always see one for none subscribers.

has allot of great books but its a buggy mess. When I play an audio book, sometimes it will do an Ai narration, so I'll have to close the app and go back in. and then MAYBE it will give me the actual narrator. sometimes when I open the app to continue where I left off on an audio book, the play button goes away, so I can't listen to it. I have to close the app, open it again, tap the book, while the book is loading I have to tap it again really quick, and only then it will have the button.

used to be 5 stars but they really dropped the ball lately. Literally everything is worse. The audio freezes near constantly. It doesn't sync with audible basically at all anymore. Takes way longer to do literally anything from browsing store, downloading and even opening books. They need to fire whoever is responsible for the last 6 months of updates.

You cannot disable one click purchasing in this app. I guess Amazon is really hard up for cash because if this app is installed on your device and you're signed into an Amazon account a single misclick will instantly purchase an entire series of books you didnt want. You cannot put a pin or a passcode or anything, just instantly take your money and you're chatting with customer service to get a refund.

I love Kindle, Kindle Unlimitrd, and Audible. I especially love the Kindle whisper-sync feature that allows to easily switch between the ebook and the audio version. However, I've noticed a few challenges with it. Once I have the ebook I usually immediately download the audio version, but lately Ive found that it will give me the assisting reader version instead, keep asking me to re-download it, or not show an audio option at all. I can open and close it several times and still not get it. 😞

love love love the kindle app! always have been and always will be a bookworm. the only thing that slightly upset me is that I lost over half the books I originally read before I learned that you absolutely MUST go all the way to the very last page to have it log as "read". Not sure if there is a setting but I've scoured the app and that is the one thing I found lacking - there is nowhere that keeps a log of the books you've read automatically - you've got to make a list & manually add them.

I use the app mainly for learning a programming language at the moment. I like that you're able to highlight and take notes within the app itself. However sometimes closing out of the notes interface by accident gets annoying, and also sometime you tap on a previous note you made and it doesn't open for a few taps. Aside from the that the app is cool.

Frustrating app because it does not sync across all platforms. If you build book collections online, they do not sync to the Android or desktop app. If you build a collection on Android, it does sync to the cloud but does not pull down collections to the android device. With hundreds of books, this is a serious flaw. As a reading app, the Android version works great on tablets and average on phones.

I've always had 2 step for purchases. I was browsing some books and somehow accidentally purchased a whole series with 1 click. I checked my bank account saw $150 purchase. Called customer service and got it all returned because it was my first accident and books weren't opened. This experience has infuriated me. I specifically had my settings 2 step and with a recent update the app settings automatically changed and the rep said can't change it. Beware!

TTS no longer works. While all the books are still there for me to read, I mostly use the Kindle app to have books read to me while I'm doing other things, like driving or doing some kind of work around the house. I don't know exactly which upgrade broke the Text-to-speech feature, but it hasn't been working for quite some time on my Samsung S23+, and apparently, Amazon is not in a hurry to fix this - despite many complaints online.

the service is great, but the app plagued by lots of tiny problems that make using it a pain. nothing fully fails to work, but it's far from smooth. open the app, select your book, and 9 of 10 times, rather than seamlessly loading up the book where you left off, it's set back a few pages, or to where you were at the beginning of last session, or it prompts you to download the audio(even if you already have it). Hard to go without it, but it's a very rough app.

Great app! I've had it for years and I love it! The only issue is when a series comes out and you can read say the first and the third parts for free but have to purchase the second part. Pretty rare for that to happen, but it's annoying when it does. p.s. Purchasing a book really isn't that expensive, just annoying when you have to in a series you've already started.

I came over when Amazon merged comixology with Kindle. All my books transferred (which is fantastic). My biggest complaint is the subscription model. A few books I've subscribed to will not auto purchase the next issue. I've checked and I am subscribed still to these series (G.I. Joe for example) and it won't auto purchase. Kindle seems to have some issues separate from the group as though it's a different book separate from the series. Please fix this if possible. Other than that the app is ok.

I love Kindle. it's a lot of fun and there are a lot of books to read. Recently the Android phone app has become difficult to use . Purchased books , especially for long-term users, can become difficult to search. Books purchased can go missing from ones library. Nothing has changed in 2025. It seems to be more difficult to find the books you've purchased.

Kindle app is fun for reading, however it is an Amazon product. You have to be very careful. Over the last few years Amazon has released "updates " for Kindle, Audible, Amazon Music Plus which were not fully tested. Frankly, they've trashed their own apps to a point many of us have considered canceling all Amazon products and services. They can't leave well enough alone. So when you wake up one day and your Kindle app isn't working right, just know you're in for 3-5 days of misery

Until a couple of months ago, I was perfectly happy with my kindle. Now it keeps kicking me off my book and when I reopen said book, it's at the last place I opened it. I've cleared the cache numerous times. The highlight thing is annoying, too. I figured out how to remove the highlight after some trial and error (go to highlight colors and touch the one that's checked and the highlight will erase), but it's a pain. FIX THIS PLEASE.

Love the app, great place to read the books I love and keep them for future re-reading.all is pretty much good...Except...hate the change of the highlights. Once I highlight, and then change my mind and want to unhighlight...I can't. it used to be that you could, and all of it was easy to do. Not anymore...I didn't know that it was broken..so why fix it..and break it at the same time.

I like that the reading challenges etc integrate more with Goodreads & that books can be purchased directly through the app again. I wish they'd leave some of the old reading insights alone because I like seeing that. I wish the notations section had more options. Edit 6/3/24 - the notations has gotten some updates that seem to be good. More highlight colors would be nice. I don't like that I can't remove a highlight as easily as before. Now you have to go into the notebook and search for it.

Lots of issues. Expensive. Support is hard to find and EXTREMELY unhelpful. After 4 hours of searching and being transferred multiple times, having a rep hang up, call back, more transfers...the conclusion was its a known problem and they are woeking on it. Note: I have been seeing this same issue for a year plus. This experience included a rep that hung up when I added that my information was the same as it was for the last 4 reps. My advice is to look at some other service. I will be.

I am getting so sick and tired of Kindle deleting my complete library and the books that I save samples of so I can read later. Even the ones that were previously free and I had got them are gone??? WTH!!! This is the 3rd time I have gone through this and it keeps happening. If it does it again I am canceling Kindle and getting a different service. I am tired of messing with it.

I don't understand why the store won't allow you to apply your earned credit to a purchase within the app. You're forced to sign in to Amazon on a browser if you want to use your credit. Why even bother having a purchase option within the app if there are things you can't do. The overall UI of the kindle store needs work which is pathetic coming from a company that eats money for breakfast.

I wake up in the middle of the night and read to distract my mind so I can fall back to sleep. It doesn't record all the days that I've read, so reading streaks are not accurate. There's always at least one day if not two or three more left off during the month. This is the second month in a row this is happened during the spring challenge. Makes me not want to bother. Edit: Just got the update that I can't buy books through the app. Why? This is totally inconvenient. Annotate update is annoying

Wonderful to have all e-books in one place. However, every time Kindle has you log back in, you will have all your books on the homepage, when you have over 12oo books like I do it's a nightmare to find the one you are currently reading. Same across all devices and if upgrading to a new one. Also, removing the books can only be done one at at a time, which takes well over an hour with that many books. Not well designed and needs major work/improvement.

App won't stay open. I open the app, and it stays on for maybe a second and then immediately closes before I can see or do anything. I've cleared the cache as suggested. I've un-installed and re-installed it multiple times. I'm frustrated because I can't read all of my downloaded/purchased materials anymore. I just updated the app hoping the glitch was fixed, but it's not. Fix this bug! 🤬

I opened it up the other day & I can no longer delete something I'd already highlighted. That really frustrates me. I often highlight something & later when it's served it's purposes I'd delete it. I hate the untidiness of it still being there. Amazon- . later the same day: I also just discovered that I don't have the search option anymore, inside the book, or the net. I valued both a lot. It helped me keep track in the book & also 2 get info that the dictionary etc didn't give.PLS fix these

the app is great, except the "lease" vs "purchase" issue. If I pay to buy the book, I don't understand the "lease" part, especially after investing about 20k on books over the years. Very horrible on amazons part, but it did make me rediscover Barnes and noble, where if you buy a book on their device, you own it and can read it on any device.

I still stand behind my review, the app is very good and I've used it for many years and have hundreds of ebooks in my library. I did like the assistive reader before, but this new "voice" is horrible, please go back to the original or another voice that isn't so high pitched. edit: after posting this review and mentioning that awful voice, nothing is being done about it, not even an answer to the complaint.

I love using kindle. But I like using it for the audio so I can get work done while still enjoying books. I've been having more and more trouble getting the audio to load even after I download it. I even tried re-installing the kindle app. I shouldn't have to jump through hoops or pay for something again to get what I want. Update, my first review was in December of 2023 it's now May of 2025 these issues have still not been fixed and have only been getting worse. The books are glitching more..

I use this app to read all kinds of books I'm interested in and never find a issue with getting a new book to read or browsing through the app to look for something new to read. I'm giving a 4-star rating because with the old version I'm able to just press the word I don't know how to pronounce & automatically a screen pops up with speaker icon and im able to press & listen to how its pronounced with ease, & can't with the updated version.

This app used to easily recognize when I had a whisper sync audible book as well and I could read and listen without issue. Now it is hit or miss on whether or not it will recognize if I have the audible book, even if it was working just a few hours before. It's completely taken away from the appeal of reading/listening to books on Kindle.

For some reason the highlighting function is very slow to respond lately in my ipad kindle. Also some books are very slow to open. This has gone on for almost a year now. I couldn't find anything useful or helpful about these particular issues in the help/support either. One more thing, it used to be very easy to put books into a series. Can't do that function anymore. I still like my Kindle but it would be appreciated if these types of ongoing issues could be resolved.

I have been using this app for years. I love that you can read or have audio. Lately, however, the audio does not work. It will read a book halfway through & then stop. Often, you can't even get the audio book to start at all. Everytime there is an update, something new goes wrong.

title: The Athletic: All Sports News
description:
Keep up with the teams you care about with The Athletic app. Review sports news, scores and stats, and expert insights analysis for each league. Turn on notifications to get real time updates for basketball, football, soccer, hockey, baseball, and more. Get in depth with sports coverage when you can listen to exclusive podcasts and read breaking news stories on your favorite athletes and teams.

Download today to stay up to date on your daily sports news.  

The Athletic Features:

EXCLUSIVE SPORTS NEWS, INSIGHTS, AND ANALYSIS
- Go deeper with in-depth, global coverage and exclusive sports news.
- Our award-winning newsroom of more than 400 sports journalists. 
- Get exclusive access to expert sports insights and analysis. 
- Explore deeply-reported long reads and exclusive sports interviews.


SPORTS SCORES AND STATS ON ALL MAJOR TEAMS AND LEAGUES
- Discover the top sports stories of the day, breaking news and live score updates, all from the biggest names in sports writing.
- Access exclusive coverage on professional and college teams across football, hockey, basketball, soccer and beyond,
- Find sports updates for the United States and international sports. 
- Follow your favorites so you never miss sports scores or stats.

UNMATCHED SPORTS PODCASTS:
- Follow and listen to a variety of sports podcasts on your favorite leagues
- Discover daily podcasts like “The Athletic Football Show”, “The Audible” and “No Dunks”.

CONNECTIONS: SPORTS EDITION
- Play The Athletic’s daily game for sports fans. 
- Group sports terms that share a common thread.

STAY UP TO DATE ON YOUR SPORTS:
- Keep track of which NFL teams are in contention for the playoffs and follow to see if the Eagles can remain on top.
- Catch all the MLB action with live scores, breaking news and in-depth coverage to see if the Dodgers can repeat their World Series win.
- Stay up to date on all NHL hockey scores, games and news for the Stanley Cup Defending Oilers.
- Don’t miss any NBA highlights and news from this upcoming season and see if the Thunder can defend their NBA Championship win.
- What school will reign supreme from March Madness to the NCAA Football Championships? Don’t miss a score or stat update.
- Stay updated on every swing from the PGA Tour to see who can stay in the lead.
- Who in the Big Six will triumph in the Premier League this year, and can Liverpool defend their title?
- Follow Argentina, Spain and France as they compete for the FIFA World Cup next summer.
- Stay up to speed on Formula 1, NASCAR, Indy Car, MotoGP and World Rally


Terms of Service: https://help.nytimes.com/hc/en-us/articles/115014893428-Terms-of-Service 

Privacy Policy: https://help.nytimes.com/hc/en-us/articles/10940941449492-The-New-York-Times-Company-Privacy-Policy
