summary: In-depth sports news and highlights: Football, basketball, baseball and hockey.

scraped_reviews.content: irritating to cancel your subscription. have to login on a browser which you've never done before to subscribe or access anything in the years I've been using it. stop making it hard to let people cancel if they don't want it anymore. ads got added and the beat writer for one of my teams got dropped and over a year later no replacement. yet we have to make it hard af to cancel come renewal time.

One star because it started glitching today. I haven't changed a single setting, but now it won't let me see stories, just asks me to subscribe. Tried logging out and back in to no avail. I can log in and read things in a browser or through the NYT app, but nada with this one. Almost forgot, it's never (not just since it broke today) let me post a comment through the app.

As far as content goes, I would give at least 4 stars and maybe 5 depending on the teams you follow. There's always something interesting in there to read if you're a sports fan. That is, if you can actually manage to get to the stories themselves, because this app is routinely just broken. At least once a week I won't be able to access anything in it, just get a repeating "something went wrong message" despite the app being fully updated and every single other app on my phone working just fine.

Great insights, but I have ZERO interest in soccer. My "FOR YOU" feed is always at least 50% soccer. i've reached out for help, but the customer team wanted me to do all the research and screen shots and forward all that to them. To make their jobs more easy, I suppose. But as a subscriber and supporter, I'm not interested in doing their work for them. Besides, isn't journalism about researching?

Great stories and the app is good, but would really love one change... When you get a notification that someone replied to your comment, clicking through takes you to the homepage and not the actual story/comment. I don't even bother trying to find the article at that point. Please update that! EDIT: Still need this in 2025!

I have been a day one Athletic subscriber, and I visit the vertical daily. I like supporting the writers, and it is has made me feel more connected to my favorite sports teams. With that said, a bug has severely hampered my ability to read articles, and I'm ready to cancel my subscription. In the app, nearly every article randomly cuts off the text halfway through the story. And the browser version of articles act like I don't have a subscription half the time. Customer service is non-existent.

I'm a big fan of The Athletic, especially the football (soccer) content, which I enjoy a lot. I listen to most of their podcasts, but I've had a tough time doing so on the website. The podcasts often stop randomly, forcing me to refresh the page and manually find where I left off. It's frustrating and disrupts the experience. The podcasts work better on Spotify, but there I have to deal with ads since it's not synced with my Athletic account. If this issue could be fixed, that would be great.

I love the content and the writing. I hate that I cannot hide scores on my feed. I have contacted support and been given instructions that do not match the app as available for Android. It's pretty frustrating. My Espn app can hide scores. So can my direct TV stream app. I am pretty sure you can hide scores on the IPhone Athletic App. I work at night and I watch sports mainly on my DVR. It is so important to be able to hide them until I want to see them.

The experience reading articles is great. Podcasts, not so much. The app doesn't let you hide podcast episodes you already played, so when one episode finishes the app will play the next episode you've already heard. Playlists? Nope. Marking episodes as played without listening to them? Nope. And you have to use the app to listen to their podcasts, with a couple of rare exceptions. The app is the sole reason I haven't listened to any of their podcasts besides the ones outside the paywall.

i installed after reading a portion of an article that I could only read in full on the app. I was able to read one more article. After that it was all about the 7 day free trial. How about giving me the trial without requiring any personal information from me. After the 7, lock it. At least your app gets thoroughly evaluated and you potentially get more subscribers.

I paid for a subscription and signed in ,but stories still won' load. I get two paragraphs and an offer for a free trial. I went through the help desk and they said the reason I was having trouble logging in was because I was using the wrong username. They provided me with the "correct" username which was some email address I have never seen or used in my life. Again, I have paid for the subscription, I am logged in, I see my favorite teams and my feed. But stories won't fully load.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you are having issues with your account. Please contact theathletic.com/contact-support and please select issue type "App Review Feedback" so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: Stories that I open in Chrome require me to open the app. When I open the app though, I'm not taken to the story. It seems like a minor thing but has a very real impact on his much Athletic content I consume. When I know that I'm going to have to search out the article once I get to the app, most of the time I just say forget it. It's unfortunate too because I really like the writers they have for my teams.

I didn't find the organization of the site to be great, you pick a team and it gives articles from all around the league. Additionally they announced ads for the platform despite paying a subscription. And with one of my favorite writers leaving for the Ringer, I can say I can't recommend this experience. I also am not a fan of thier business model. I signed up on a new season deal last year, and didn't realize I was auto-enrolled on a yearly subscription for a much higher price.

I am unlikely to re-subscribe after my trial membership because I don't use it much: articles are too long (I have other things to read for my job). What would make all the difference for me is a built-in TTS reader so that I can consume Athletic articles when I'm doing other things, such as doing the dishes. An ePub reader I have used for over a decade, Cool Reader, has one that works well enough.

The Athletic is a 5-star product! The app is not quite all the way there cons: It can be a little hard to find what you were reading or listening to if the app closes, and it would be nice if you could slow down the podcast play speed without speeding it up first (you have to cycle through the speeds). pros: top-knotch, high-quality content, with no ads if you pay for a subscription. I follow the NBA specifically and the coverage is really really good
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you are having issues with your account. Please contact theathletic.com/contact-support and please select issue type "App Review Feedback" so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: The Athletic has great content, but watch your billing. I signed up at a discount and was charged 4-6 times a month at the full rate. They took 3 months to figure it out. In the process they cancelled a gift account I bought for someone and told me I would have to repurchase it at twice the cost. I had to come here and leave a review before I was fully refunded for all of the overcharges. They also gave me a free year, which makes repurchasing the gift sub at full price a bit easier.

I really do love the content. It is the best journalism in sports. But the app leaves a lot to be desired. Scores only come through for certain teams. Other teams and leagues don't even show scores or standings to begin with. I don't like having to juggle back and forth between this app and another app just to view scores. Please make the app more robust from a scores standpoint! The live blogs that follow certain tournaments are great, but the sports should show up in the "scores" section of the app too.

The content is fantastic, of course. However, the app leaves a lot to be desired. My biggest complaint is that if it loses focus on the article you're reading if you briefly switch to another app or follow a link. It backs you all the way out to the start page, forcing you to repeatedly search for the article you're trying to read all over again. I prefer to load the full website in a mobile browser instead.

Good, but there's a bug and I can't figure out how to get past it. When I try to link from a notification directly to a story on my Google Pixel 2 XL, it gives me an error stating that "something went wrong loading the article. Please try again later." This happens pretty consistently, but if I go directly from the app, it's no problem to load the story. Something is broken. Please fix!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for supporting The Athletic and reporting this issue. Our engineers are aware of the issues with notifications loading and are working to fix it. We hope you enjoy the rest of your experience with The Athletic.

scraped_reviews.content: While the content is decent, be sure to check the bank account you use to sign up. I selected the monthly plan, which starts after a 7 day trial period. I noticed a couple days after I expected to be charged that I was charged for the annual plan (charged up front) instead of the monthly. I contacted them about issuing a partial refund, and to place me on the monthly subscription like I had selected, and all I got was a rude response and no help at all. Won't renew due to the customer service.

Meh... maybe you'd get more subscribers if you didn't try to shove it down everyone's throats. Forced to download the app to read "free" articles, reluctantly did so eventually and I still can't even read any articles with out being forced to sign up for a "free" trial (just give us your credit card number!) Overall just feels like a cash grab for the type of sports coverage that probably isn't worth a subscription to begin with. 1/10

Update* They did not cancel my subscription upon request. Instead they sent me a $3 coupon and asked me to stay. I had to request the refund a second time. The app is so incredibly slow, bloated and buggy. Articles and comments take forever to load. Notifications on your comments just take you to the comments, not your comment and you can't navigate to your comments from anywhere. The navigation to content is not intuitive, it doesn't make sense and tbh there isn't a lot of content (NFL)

Was reading an article that said install app to continue reading. It isn't until after you've downloaded the app that it bothers telling you you've subscribed, then they want another $10 a month to actually read anything. Pretty crappy tactic that ensures I don't click on any of your articles in the future, I'm just going to assume you're going to want money to let me read anything.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We do offer free trials and special rates for new subscribers. If you would like assistance in obtaining a trial or a discount please contact support@theathletic.com and mention your review name "Claudia Reynolds".

scraped_reviews.content: Haven't been able to use the app in weeks. Won't let me log in just keeps saying error. I get updates, but can't read anything. emailed support and after the initial "log out and log back in" and "change your password" I told them that didn't work and didn't hear anything for 4 days until I emailed them telling them I was upset with the costumer service. When they responder 2 days later they said they know about the issue and are working on it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you are having issues with your account. Please contact theathletic.com/contact-support and please select issue type "App Review Feedback" so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: I subscribed to this app for a few years and enjoyed great content. Two weeks ago, the writer for my team (Michigan State) was reassigned to the lions and the athletic decided that they weren't going to hire a replacement. I asked for a pro-rated refund for the remaining time on my yearly subscription and they refused. Unless you want to be left hanging once they decide your team doesn't need to be covered any more, save your money instead

My feed has not updated since Jan 26. Links in twitter no longer open in the app. When I search the app for that writer, the article still doesn't show up. But surprisingly, email from the athletic that contains a short part of articles with the button to continue reading in app all work. The app opens and the right article is there. What's going on?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: You can update your feed by placing your finger at the top of your feed and pulling down. To open articles from twitter go to Theathletic.com on your phone's browser. Click the menu bar on the website and sign in. Click open in-app. If you have any more questions please contact support@theathletic.com and mention your review name "Grace Garbe".

scraped_reviews.content: I joined The Athletic for the great articles. I have been disappointed by the insufficient availability of stats, scores and standings. This app provides the basics for games and standings. It was really bad that they had the stats to a CFB game backwards for a while yesterday. It seems to me that the numbers are an afterthought to the articles.

Used to be a great app but recently there are a couple of issues that have led me to uninstall and use the website instead. 1. Got rid of the ability to swipe between teams at the top. 2. Including ads in an app that I pay a fee to access, which is absolutely ridiculous. I'll use a browser with ad block instead, thanks. The other thing they really need to improve is they need to add PGA leaderboards. Unbelievable they have PGA coverage but not a leaderboard!

HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO LOG IN FOR WEEKS. Not only have I paid for a subscription that I haven't even been able to use, but every time I try to log in its giving me all sorts of errors, I log in and right after that, it tells me to log in over and over, as if the app doesn't even register that I am indeed logged in. Telling me I need to subscribe over and over, even though I already have, again as if it it isn't registering that I am already subscribed/logged in. SO FREAKING ANNOYING. FIX IT!!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry about that! Please update your application to the newest version to ensure the best compatibility. If you are still having a problem, log out and log back in. Let me know if you have any issues after updating and logging out and back in at theathletic.com/contact-support so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: I really like the writers, the stories, and I would recommend subscribing to them, you can usually find a deal, so I don't think you'll ever really have to pay the full price. For me the only issue is with the app. If I'm on Twitter or Facebook and I click a story, more often than not, it links to the play store instead of too the article. It just makes it more difficult to read content. Besides that, no real issues.

App is attractive, stable, and easy to navigate. Content and coverage is excellent. Podcasts are a nice bonus, though I wish there were more (specifically European soccer). Only thing holding it back from 5 stars: I wish I could check scores from leagues/sports I don't "follow." I don't want NFL or MLB stories clogging up my feed, but I'd sure like to be able to check game scores...

I love The Athletic, and while the writing is well worth the cost of the membership, the Android app is super buggy. First, the podcast player rarely loads. I've tried it on two Android phones with the same result. Support says they're working on a fix. Hope it gets fixed soon, because I really enjoy the podcasts. Recently, many stories on my app simply aren't there. They appear on my iPad app and on the desktop, but not on my Android. Support was no help, saying that it is working correctly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello John. We are sorry to see you are having trouble with podcasts. We are providing an update to fix these issues very soon. We would like to look more into the issue you are experiencing with articles. 
Please contact support@theathletic.com and mention your review name "John McGee".

scraped_reviews.content: Content is incredible. The podcast player is not good. There is no queue, and the speed setting resets after pausing for too long. Also, the notification shade controls don't skip within the current podcast but jump to the previous and next. If you try to get back to where you were, the app will start you over at the beginning of the episode. Still a mess, just slightless so. For articles, it's lacking text to speech that iOS has. Content is great, can you read it to me in my car, please?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you are having issues with podcasts. Please contact theathletic.com/contact-support and please select issue type "App Review Feedback" so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: Great service, meh app. My main gripe is that when you press a notification 9/10 times it just puts you on the main page and I have to look through it to find the story I want. Also, I love the design of the app, but there's this weird thing where the bottom 1/4th of text is cut off on the titles for the must read section (inside the grey boxes.) It's a small thing, but it needs to be fixed.

The podcasts need some serious work. First off, they randomly start playing even when i force close the app - unacceptable. Second, there is no basic functionality like auto download or queuing. Third, the UI is terribly unintuitive and it's very difficult to get to even a list of all the episodes of a particular podcast. Fourth, it autoplays the next episode of a podcast after the previous one is finished. Fifth, the back and forward on the notification do not work like other podcast apps.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We take feedback seriously and are currently working on all of these issues and expect to release an update very soon. Thank you for your patience while we work to provide the best experience possible.

scraped_reviews.content: Nice Try. I just wanted to read an article on the internet, not commit to a subscription service for access to occasional pieces that get my attention from time to time. You might want to consider creating a free and a paid version of the app. The way its set up now should be free. Once you get the podcasts in order and add some other perks, then consider charging a premium. Good luck.

The content is great. I love the writing from The Athletic - well worth the money. The app is... Okay. There need to be more filters and content could be arranged better. The scores tab is completely useless. No rhyme or reason to the organization, with seemingly no ability to filter. The scores also don't all seem to update properly. I think I might as well stick with just accessing the mobile version of the website.

Seriously? Auto playing videos. I won't be launching this app at work anymore as I can't see where to disable that 'feature'. It's asinine that anyone would have that on by default. Also, the sheer number of trackers this app employs is shocking. That means when I click on any notification link, it takes minutes to actually launch the story because I block them. You get 2 stars only because I like some of the writers.

I signed up for the free 7-day trial just to read one article. When I went to cancel on the 7th day it was very difficult to find out how to cancel through the app. By the time I figured it out I had been charged for th year subscription. Ok no big deal, I'll just email them and they will refund it. Instead I get told they can't offer a refund with subscriptions through google play. So I contact google play and they tell me to contact the developer. Very poor business!

I'll often choose to listen to the ad version of the podcasts in a better player. It is really basic and missing a lot of commonplace features. I would love to be able to see my downloaded podcast in a list [edit: I found this option is at the very bottom of my podcast feed], or be able to cast to another device. Playlists would be helpful because it just autoplays the next podcast in the same series whether you have listened to or not.

Great content, horrid user interface. The company doesn't care about it's subscribers. The ads on some podcasts for subscribers is plain false advertising. The app lacks basic user settings like mark as read/unread, a "placeholder" capability to return to where you left off, and auto download podcasts (maybe because the podcasts routinely don't download correctly.) The most recent update makes it more difficult to bookmark articles and find articles you saved.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. I will forward this to our product team.

scraped_reviews.content: subpar experience. it provides lots of options to choose the teams, sports, and types of news important to you and yet seems to completely ignore those preferences and provide recommendations completely unrelated to your preferences. also, despite a hefty subscription fee it is rife with large ads constantly getting in the way.

I've started to get ads for location-specific sports betting on this app. I literally paid a subscription to the Athletic so that my personal information wouldn't be used for advertising. Never mind that I also paid for it so I wouldn't see ads, period. When I reached out to the Athletic about it, their help desk just contacted me to help with a password reset lol. I've canceled my renewal and won't be back.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you are having issues with our application. Please contact us at theathletic.com/contact-support and please select issue type " App Store/Google Play Review Follow-up" so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: Like redesign but podcasts too buried. I see the ones you follow are interspersed in the feed. If thats how they are treated then why not provide them as an option to follow just like the teams and leagues so they show up at the top? Or at the bottom add a 5th option for "Podcasts" on the end next to "Scores". It'll be a little crowded but it seems do-able.

The app is terrible. Major trades happen that I'm the last to know about because I PAID for a subscription to the athletic where notifications rarely work and stories are super late vs getting a free app. The scores section shows some scores, but half the time current games don't show up, so if I want to know if I should watch a game, I have to go somewhere else to find out of it's close. Between no breaking news, scores not showing and stories that aren't interesting, I wasted a lot of money

Would've given a much better review a week ago. Now for almost a week a majority of articles are cut off in the middle with much of it just being ablack screen. "Customer Service" has been anything but. Autoreply to emails saying I may have to open the articles 2 or 3x. Well 10+ times & still black screen. Apparently the only way to get their attention will be to cancel.

Love the content and the layout! Would be 5 stars, but when I open an article through a push notification I get the content in raw HTML format. Additionally, I'm not sure why the articles I receive in notifications are not otherwise accessible from the app. I usually have to wait for 30 mins - 1 hour until I can find those articles on the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you are having issues with your account. Please contact theathletic.com/contact-support and please select issue type "App Review Feedback" so we may assist you directly.

scraped_reviews.content: I joined at $1 a month for 6 months and every article I clicked on, the text ended and I was prompted to subscribe after the first paragraphbin order to read further. Customer service was no help, they just told me to uninstall and reinstall the app to which did nothing. I didn't waste much money, but still that annoying I got no content on a "special offer." Bait and switch b.s. going on here. Grade: F.

I was trying to read an article online, and it says that I must download this app in order to finish reading it for free. So I download the app. Log in with my Facebook account. Select a favorite team /league. Find the article. Click on it. I get a popup that says I have to pay $60 a year to read the premium content. Nope. False advertising (said I could read it for free by simply downloading) and there is no way it can be worth it. Uninstalled. Good luck!

Imbedded videos (usually from Twitter) don't play well. Video freezes and lags behind audio 100 percent of the time. Never used to be an issue but probably after an update, it's a problem and does frustrate me. For a subscription service I do expect more. It's been this way for a few months now. Will I renew next year? Maybe.

title: Flightradar24 Flight Tracker
description: The world's most popular flight tracker - #1 Travel app in over 150 countries. Turn your phone or tablet into a live plane tracker and see flights around the world move in real-time on a detailed map. Or point your device at a airplane to find out where it’s going and what kind of aircraft it is. Download for free today and discover why millions track flights and check their flight status with Flightradar24. Favorite features - Watch aircraft move around the world in real-time - Identify flights overhead & see flight information—including a photo of the actual airplane —by pointing your device at the sky - See what the pilot of an aircraft sees in 3D - View a flight in 3D and see hundreds of airline liveries - Tap on a plane for flight details such as route, estimated time of arrival, actual time of departure, aircraft type, speed, altitude, high-resolution photos of the actual aircraft & more - See historical data & watch playback of past flights - Tap on an airport icon for arrivals & departures, flight status, aircraft on the ground, current delays, & detailed weather conditions - Search for individual flights using flight number, airport, or airline - Filter flights by airline, aircraft, altitude, speed, & more - With Wear OS you can view a list of nearby aircraft, see basic flight information and view the aircraft on the map when you tap on it Flightradar24 is a free flight tracker app and includes all the above features. If you want even more great features from Flightradar24 there are two upgrade options—Silver & Gold—and each comes with a free trial. Flightradar24 Silver - 90 days of flight tracking history - More aircraft details, like serial number & age - More flight details, like vertical speed & squawk - Filters and alerts to find and track flights you’re interested in - Current weather at 3,000+ airports overlaid on the map Flightradar24 Gold - All the features included in Flightradar24 Silver + - 365 days of flight history - Detailed live map weather layers for clouds & precipitation - Aeronautical charts & oceanic tracks showing the pathways flights follow across the sky - Air traffic control (ATC) boundaries that show which controllers are responsible for a flight - Extended Mode S data—even more information about a flight’s altitude, speed, and wind & temperature conditions during flight, when available Silver and Gold upgrade prices are listed in the app as they vary depending on your country and currency. If you choose to upgrade, subscriptions will be charged to the payment method used for your Google account. Your subscription will automatically renew unless cancelled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. You manage your subscription through your Google Play Account Settings. How it works Most aircraft today are equipped with ADS-B transponders that transmit positional data. Flightradar24 has a rapidly growing network of over 50,000 ground stations around the world to receive this data that then shows up as aircraft moving on a map in the app. In an expanding number of regions, with the help of multilateration, we’re able to calculate the positions of aircraft that don’t have ADS-B transponders. Coverage in North America is also supplemented by real-time radar data. Coverage is variable and subject to change at any time. Connect with Flightradar24 We love getting feedback on FR24. Since we’re unable to respond directly to reviews, contact us directly and we’ll be happy to assist. Email (support@fr24.com) X (@Flightradar24) Facebook (@Flightradar24) YouTube (@Flightradar24DotCom) Disclaimer The use of this app is strictly limited to entertainment purposes. This specifically excludes activities that might endanger yourself or the lives of others. Under no circumstances will the developer of this app be held responsible for incidents resulting from the use of the data or its interpretation or its use contrary to this agreement.
descriptionHTML:
The world's most popular flight tracker - #1 Travel app in over 150 countries.

Turn your phone or tablet into a live plane tracker and see flights around the world move in real-time on a detailed map. Or point your device at a airplane to find out where it’s going and what kind of aircraft it is. Download for free today and discover why millions track flights and check their flight status with Flightradar24.

Favorite features
- Watch aircraft move around the world in real-time
- Identify flights overhead & see flight information—including a photo of the actual airplane —by pointing your device at the sky
- See what the pilot of an aircraft sees in 3D
- View a flight in 3D and see hundreds of airline liveries
- Tap on a plane for flight details such as route, estimated time of arrival, actual time of departure, aircraft type, speed, altitude, high-resolution photos of the actual aircraft & more
- See historical data & watch playback of past flights
- Tap on an airport icon for arrivals & departures, flight status, aircraft on the ground, current delays, & detailed weather conditions
- Search for individual flights using flight number, airport, or airline
- Filter flights by airline, aircraft, altitude, speed, & more
- With Wear OS you can view a list of nearby aircraft, see basic flight information and view the aircraft on the map when you tap on it

Flightradar24 is a free flight tracker app and includes all the above features. If you want even more great features from Flightradar24 there are two upgrade options—Silver & Gold—and each comes with a free trial.

Flightradar24 Silver
- 90 days of flight tracking history
- More aircraft details, like serial number & age
- More flight details, like vertical speed & squawk
- Filters and alerts to find and track flights you’re interested in
- Current weather at 3,000+ airports overlaid on the map

Flightradar24 Gold
- All the features included in Flightradar24 Silver +
- 365 days of flight history
- Detailed live map weather layers for clouds & precipitation
- Aeronautical charts & oceanic tracks showing the pathways flights follow across the sky
- Air traffic control (ATC) boundaries that show which controllers are responsible for a flight
- Extended Mode S data—even more information about a flight’s altitude, speed, and wind & temperature conditions during flight, when available

Silver and Gold upgrade prices are listed in the app as they vary depending on your country and currency. If you choose to upgrade, subscriptions will be charged to the payment method used for your Google account. Your subscription will automatically renew unless cancelled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. You manage your subscription through your Google Play Account Settings.

How it works
Most aircraft today are equipped with ADS-B transponders that transmit positional data. Flightradar24 has a rapidly growing network of over 50,000 ground stations around the world to receive this data that then shows up as aircraft moving on a map in the app. In an expanding number of regions, with the help of multilateration, we’re able to calculate the positions of aircraft that don’t have ADS-B transponders. Coverage in North America is also supplemented by real-time radar data. Coverage is variable and subject to change at any time.

Connect with Flightradar24
We love getting feedback on FR24. Since we’re unable to respond directly to reviews, contact us directly and we’ll be happy to assist.
Email (support@fr24.com)
X (@Flightradar24)
Facebook (@Flightradar24)
YouTube (@Flightradar24DotCom)

Disclaimer
The use of this app is strictly limited to entertainment purposes. This specifically excludes activities that might endanger yourself or the lives of others. Under no circumstances will the developer of this app be held responsible for incidents resulting from the use of the data or its interpretation or its use contrary to this agreement.
summary: Track airplanes and follow flights with our real-time flight tracker

scraped_reviews.content: I started using this app initially for the Skycard's game that is also by Flightradar24 to look at where different aircraft were but I've come to use it just about whenever I'm bored and find it fascinating! Especially with me, my family, and friends traveling as much as we all do, it's cool to see when planes are consistently late, on time, or even early. I would recommend this app for it's free version but I will admit that I got the Gold plan for $40 a year.

I would say this is a good app to find flights, it can show planes nearby, and you can look up and see, but it has a few issues. For example, using the AR feature, it only works best when the plane is close, because the arrow is always pointing at the wrong place, and the box is covering the plane on camera. And in the feature, it has a tiny map with a slide to have the radar look farther for planes, but they always show the plane facing the wrong way, so I think it's going my way, but it isn't.

This is a cool app with enough free features to keep you watching flights for hours. Haven't had any major problems. Not glitchy. Some ads but what do you expect these days. Edit: I have dropped two stars because while watching a flight long enough, an ad will automatically exit the app and redirect to your web browser. That's not acceptable and I will be deleting this app if that continues.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for the review. Could you please share more details with us by emailing support@fr24.com? We'll check them. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: there is no easy way to cancel this and they will keep taking your money every year. whether you use it or not. so if you stop using it you can expect an annual theft from your banking account. I contacted the service dept and they still won't credit my account back for something they know I don't use and they just took it out for the year.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for the review. Could you please share more details with us by emailing support@fr24.com? We'll check them. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: I had the old app which I was very happy with and suddenly I was apparently paying for a monthly gold subscription without me accepting such a thing. Using the free version nowadays and the intrusive ads are extremely annoying, they'll open up their own page and then you have to restart Flightradar to be able to use it again.

Every time I open this app, I'm bombarded with a 'Your Privacy' pop-up 'We collect sensitive personal data and we share or sell it to third parties'. This happens even though I'm a paid gold subscriber! It feels like they're actively trying to get me to accidentally hit 'Agree and Close' instead of the 'Do Not Share, or Opt-out' button. To actually opt out, I have to go through a frustratingly long process that takes like 7 clicks! This is a dark pattern and a major privacy concern.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Flightradar24 does NOT sell location data. To help keep Flightradar24 free, we use anonymized and approximate location data (only with user permission) for ads. Individual users can’t be identified, and subscribers are not affected. Make sure that you are logged into your Gold account. You can manage your data sharing permissions in Settings.

scraped_reviews.content: I LOVE FLIGHTRADAR APP!!! I'm honestly surprised I've been using this app for at least 2 and a 1/2 years and haven't rated it yet. I have learned so much since I started using flightradar. My husband gifted me a one year "Silver" membership for my birthday early this year and debating moving up to "Gold" On my next birthday. BUT the free version is absolutely amazing with plenty of features. It's just so fun to see and know the type of aircraft flying over your house!

They have probably the most obnoxious screens that pop up asking if it's okay to sell your personal data. It is not at all intuitive how to get out of these screens, and I'm not certain I was even successful in opting out. Complicating that is their decision to place the Save button in a location which is hidden by the tool which expands and reduces the screen, making it all but invisible and impossible to access. Really sucky job for an app I pay a lot of money to use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Please contact us at support@fr24.com with more details, and we’ll be happy to look into the issue. Thank you in advance!

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using flight radar for years to look for gaps between flights. I even made app purchases that gave me icon improvements but then they changed the subscription levels and now I don't get to have my purchased upgrades anymore without a subscription. So basically feels theft by moving the goal posts. Caveat emptor.

I am using the free version of this app to keep an eye on aircraft fighting wildfires in the area, and it works great for this. Sometimes the aircraft drops off view, but that's technology and probably terrain issues. My only regret, which is unavoidable, is that it requires data, so if i'm hiking in an area without service, there is no connection and aircraft can't be tracked. But that's not the fault of the app at all.

I checked my email, I also paid for the premium version of this app in Feb 2017. I'm also going to delete the app right before the 90 day free trial ends. I will not be bombarded with ads and I won't pay $10 a year for an app that I use less than 5 minutes a month. I have no interest in you asking me to email you, so you can tell me how the old app was from 2010 and new technologies had to be employed. Tech gets cheaper as years go by, not more expensive by 20 times or more. Do whats right!

If you buy the top version there are lots more things available. But the free version let's me identify any airplane that is on active radar. It also allows me to track the flight if I care to. It gives me the N number, type of craft, altitude, ground speed, and usually point of origination. If you have a friend going on a commercial flight and they give you the flight number, you can track the flight. Fun and handy app.

After initial install it worked great but after about 45 days more and more adverts to subscribe for monthly fee. At same time flightradar became slower, less accurate, seemingly buggy in the free version. Standing within 5 ft of my neighbor with the most basic paid version the tracking was more accurate, the info displayed was much more accurate. He has a few 'enhancements' that the free version doesn't have but for almost $35 USD per year..? He says he won't recommend / nor is he renewing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We’d like to know the details of the problem you mentioned. Please send the details or screenshot to support@fr24.com. We'll pass it along to our development team and see if there is any way we can improve it.

scraped_reviews.content: I don't trust this developer. It left users of the previous PURCHASED version out in the cold with only an offer of an extended free trial. NO, I purchased this app with a one-time fee and I do not understand why they cannot honor these purchasers with a basic, ad-free experience. Install at your own risk and subscribe knowing that at anytime after you have paid, they will change the terms again and it's either pay up or get out. I don't see much more new in this version of the app than I did in the old. If you paid for the old and end up installing this one, you'll see pretty much the same thing with the exception of a huge ad at the top until you subscribe.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi! Thank you for contacting us!
Seems like your review is about the Pro app and not about the current app.
The Pro app has been supported for nearly 10 years but it has finally come to its end-of-life. If you have any questions about the Pro app then please contact support@fr24.com so we can assist you.
Margaret

scraped_reviews.content: Stopped working completely. I loved this app and was going to purchase a sub or whatever a year ago, but then it stopped working. Updates didn't help, not better on a different phone. No point in paying for an app that doesn't work. update: adverts are intrusive and their X doesn't work, so there's no point in viewing them because you can't close them. Do better than the garbate scam adverts.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: The DDoS attack has ended, allowing us to open services that have been blocked for the past 48 hours. We continue to monitor the situation and ask our users to contact support@fr24.com if they are still experiencing problems with the site or apps. Thank you very much for your patience and support!

scraped_reviews.content: Flight Radar 24 service is getting worse and worse. If it is not persistent outages it is other issues. I love this app but this time they went too far. I have an active paid subscription for the Gold plan. Shorty after the monthly charge was taken out of my account they switched me back to basic. So, they took my money and ran basically. I paid for the service and I am not recieving what I paid for. I emailed customer service, they told me my account has expired but yet it shows paid for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Kelly! Thank you for writing this review as well as contacting us at support. Since we explained where the issue was
and provided you with your paid functional service, would you mind updating us if it is all good know and maybe worth more than just 1*?

Thank you very much in advance, hope you do enjoy our app and keep loving it!

KR,
Stefani

scraped_reviews.content: Until installing the latest update, I would have given this app a five-star rating. The new update limits the filter options so much, it's pointless. The filters I was using was simply altitude and speed. If someone can show me how to do that without having to pay for it, I'd greatly appreciate it. Or, better yet, help me uninstall the latest update.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kelli, thanks for reaching out. Please make sure to contact us at support@fr24.com and we will be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: Love that I can see what's flying over, with the exception of most military aircraft (which is understandable). Some info is occasionally missing from a few flights, a few have incorrect photos of the model of aircraft, but most have good info. I enjoy getting Featured Flight notifications - I was able to watch the last flight of Quantas 747 as it drew it's logo over the skies of Australia. I also like that I can get notified when my favourite birds are up, either by model or tail number.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey! Thank you very much for taking the time to write to us, it means a lot! Please let us know if we could improve somehow and earn (even) higher rate/more stars at support@fr24.com. Thank you for using our app and have a great day ahead! Stef

scraped_reviews.content: I have been using Flightradar24 for over 10 years, and the Android app for 5-10 years. It has always been my go-to flight tracker. Improvements are made frequently, and the app just keep getting better. It is not bogged down by including features not important to its basic premise. Help is supplied quickly and in a friendly fashion. I use some other flight trackers but always come back to Flightradar24. Keep up the good work!

Works again after map hotfix but really, what's the point? As a purchaser of the former pro version, I, like all the others, have been abandoned by the developer when they upgraded the app to require a paid subscription. Now, to keep the benefits we had as an original purchaser, they want us to pay again. And again, and again, etc, etc, etc. No thanks!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review and your support. Flightradar24 has been supporting the old Pro app for 10+ years. As we have big costs running and maintaining the radar network we can only give access to premium features with an ongoing subscription. Most Pro features are now free and as a user of the Pro app you have a special offer for premium access.

scraped_reviews.content: I'll keep my old paid version. It does the job. Too many nags to update, too many ads. To get all the features is too expensive and it's an annual fee on top of that. Upgraded version is not for the causal user. Also, the squawk feature won't turn off even if unchecked. Annoying. Had some trouble trying to track back to back flights. It only kept the first flight active in the search box and would not load the second flight even after it was airborne until about an hour into its flight. The old version worked fine. The rest of the app works great and is enjoyable. But not for the price.

Great app. Fast, clear, easy to use, and yes, the free version is quite usable, with small, unobtrusive ads. But if you really enjoy planespotting (and want to thank the devs), it's worth it to buy the full package of features (the weather options alone might even take the place of your current weather app). I paid for the full version, and I don't even fly. Terrified of flying, in fact. Hate it. But I really enjoy planespotting, and wouldn't be without Flightradar24.

Best free tracker I've ever used! Definitely the most accurate one, and being able to watch the icons taxiing, taking off, and landing is really cool. My only issue is that it seems to not be very precise on the takeoff and landing areas. The icons will freeze at the beginning of takeoff, overshoot the runway every landing, and the altitude indicator will continue to read 800ft after landing. Still the best free app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for your review. Ground & low altitude coverage (which includes landings and take-offs) depend on different factors, such as the number of nearby receivers, terrain, weather, etc.
We constantly increase coverage in all parts of the world, but it is also possible that some receivers go temporarily or permanently offline.

scraped_reviews.content: I have used both free and paid versions of this app. In the free version, ads are not excessive, which I appreciate. There are different paid version tiers, and I settled on Silver for the flight data I like to see. $10 / year is a great price for what you get for this tier. It's also intuitive to use at a surface level, and there's more to explore if you want to dive deeper. All in all, excellent app!

I do car service from multiple airports. This app has improved to become the best choice for me. I can track specific flights, or see all the incoming traffic to a specific airport. The paid version is well worth the extra information, if you fly more than a couple times a year. The $10 a year subscription gives me all I need, for less than a buck a month. As I track a flight, the location on the map is very accurate. Then it tells me what gate my customers are deplaning at. Great app!

Tried the 1 week free trial, glad I didn't have to pay for it beforehand. Needed Filters & Alerts but couldn't get Alerts to work properly the whole week. The app should send an Alert when your chosen plane enters the map area selected. This would work on 1 of every 10 planes. The rest were on the ground when I got an alert even though I didn't adjust altitude settings to zero (or set them at all). Fix this and I'll be happy to pay your yearly fee.

I've been using FlightRadar24 for almost a decade. But after latest update, app is no longer what it used to be. Info that was previously freely accesible, now is only available through fee subscription. Also, now you are required to log in every simple time you want to look info up. Tracking a single flight for either take-off or arrival time takes way too many steps and has gotten cumbersome. You can get the same info using other apps such as Flight Aware.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear about your experience. Please email us more details to support@fr24.com and we'll assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: So I paid for your "old" app's Pro version. Not a SUBSCRIPTION. Because of some notification issues (which I don't use) you're pushing me to download the "new" app (which I did), offering 3 free months of a subscription (which I don't want), and STILL only allow me to choose one label for flights!! In the version I paid for, I could choose up to 4 labels (I chose 3.) Leaves a bad aftertaste when a company, after taking your money, decides it will try to squeeze you for more. I don't like it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
I am sorry to hear this, Mike! Let me try to explain: the old Pro app and this Free app are 2 different apps. We have been supporting the Pro app for almost 10 years but now the platform has reached its end-of-life. If you are still facing issues, please contact support@fr24.com and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
BR,
Stefani

scraped_reviews.content: GREAT APP! Lets you track commercial flights worldwide along with most private aircraft and a few military. I'm about 30 miles from Fort Indian Town Gap in PA and can watch some of their training missions. I have the paid version which lets you see the ground below or ahead of the aircraft. It's a pretty cool option but eats up your data, so I only use it when I'm connected to Wifi. Even then, not much. It is pretty interesting, though, to watch the runway as they approach and land.

The app changed today. It was great before; I have had a gold subscription, but lost my filters. I don't remember any type of notification popping up or any type of email warning people of it. If there was, it wasn't enough for me to notice. I had mentioned it on X and their response was retweeting at me something they sent out on December 23rd. Update: The update is good overall, it covers a lot of my filters as "built in" filters anyway. But it still sucks I lost the one-offs.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! Previously configured filters in the app have not been automatically transferred and will need to be set up manually. We apologize for any inconvenience. We hope you enjoy the enhanced options and follow us on social media to stay updated on future features!

scraped_reviews.content: Not a happy camper. No longer have access to extra features I paid for. What is going on? This is inexcusable, I paid for the extra features and should have been grandfathered into what ever newer versions are developed, afterall, without mine and thousands of other paying customers money, you wouldn't have the ability to develop new and improved versions.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review and support. This app is not a new app. Both this and the old Pro app were released in 2010 - 10 years ago. As we are not getting any new sales from the old pro app we are not able to keep support for the app. We are delivering an ongoing service with ongoing costs. Please contact support@fr24.com if you have any questions

scraped_reviews.content: I am really happy with the application and often spend hours in front of my computer looking at all the various different kinds of aircraft. I am a military aircraft buff and understand regarding the blockage of Military Jet aircraft transponders (USAF, USN, USMC and USCG and other jet aircraft). BUT, why aren't there photos attached/linked with Jetphotos if I can find the Aircraft (Registration) on Jetphotos? I've asked before but no answer. I LOVE the app!!!! I want to learn to use it better!

Don't waste your time with this app. They literally make the app slow so you're forced to buy a upgraded subscription. Not all of us are going to fork out 5-10 bucks a month to use a app they may only have open once or twice a month if that. Even the basic account is way to packed full of ads to a point it's unusable. Sorry, but I'll be using another app. TY.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for the review. Could you please share more details with us by emailing support@fr24.com? We'll check them. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: Very detailed app when it comes to tracking flights, viewing history of the aircraft as far as where it's been, the age of the aircraft by showing how long it has been it service and multiple picture of the actual aircraft. my biggest gripe is probably a small one. The ability to save the track aircraft that you are looking for. To like a list. That has alerts to it I will notify you when an aircraft is went a specific range or on the ground.

Used to work really well... now it's a laggy jumbled mess of icons because the option to sort by altitude is unavailable for free users. I get you gotta make money to maintain the app, but you gotta understand how badly you screwed up your app for a lot of users. I'm even reading the paid subscription version is really messed up according to other reviews, so why you as a company have the impression I would want to actually buy the paid subscription knowing that it's just as bad is beyond me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We’re sorry to hear that you’re not satisfied. Please reach out with more details at support@fr24.com, and we’ll be happy to assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Absolutely awesome! If you've ever heard a plane or helicoptor, or looked up to see a jet contrail and wondered where it was going, came from, who owns it, what it actually looks like, how high/fast it is, etc., then I highly recommend this app. Very user-friendly, and accurate real time data for just about everything you'll see in the skies, including commercial, private, police, and most military transport aircraft. Only combat craft and a few old planes did not show up for obvious reasons.

Destination is often missing. Origin is occasionally as well. When I check those same flights on FlightAware, they're not missing. Need to be able to show more text labels on the map for each flight than just aircraft type. Need to be able to view origin and destination on the arrival departure boards. Map type coloring needs improvement, especially the darker ones (hard to see details). Update: I'veso noticed some flights are just missing (but FA shows them), and wrong pictures.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Brian! Thank you for your feedback, it means a lot to us as we continuously work on improving. Sorry to hear you´re not satisfied, hope we can gain your trust back and raise that rate from 1 to 5 in no time. Map is provided by third party, so we cannot do anything about it. Please contact support@fr24.com for more info.
Have a great day!
Stefani

scraped_reviews.content: Yet again, another disappointment. I pay for a subscription to use this app, and for the past couple of days it hasn't worked. I recieve notifications as if its working and for followed flights and emergencies, but when I open the app it just crashes. Between getting ripped off after buying the full version several years ago and now having to pay for a subscription, and now paying for things that don't work, Flightradar24 is dropping very quickly on my recommendations and favorite apps list.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Chris,
Many companies had an issue around 25 April because the Google Maps API has crashed. I'm happy to inform you that the issue with the app is solved. Please check if you are able to use the app now.
You can contact us at support@fr24.com anytime if you need any help.
Margaret

scraped_reviews.content: Update June 14 2024: something has changed, maybe it's the free version, or maybe they no longer get accurate information. Several times in the past two months this App has said my American Airlines flight was on time when it clearly was not. I could see maybe 1-3 minutes off but it has been worse (yesterday over 30 min!!) The announcements at the gate are more reliable than this app now-a-days, it used to be the complete opposite. I guess I can still look at the pretty planes and ID them.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there and thanks for reaching out. Please make sure to contact us at support@fr24.com with more details and screenshots and we will be happy to look into this issue. Thank you very much in advance!

scraped_reviews.content: It's always a great tool to have especially if you are a frequent flyer or you just love aviation. It's great when you can track your own flight if your plane has good WiFi signal and it's cool to see how accurate it is when your GPS works with the app. To get the best out of the app I recommend that you pay for it yearly look for the deals or promotions.

It does as good as you can expect. It does not put you on the planes exact location but pretty close. You are able to track most planes if you spot one in the air. It works very well on most airports departing and incoming flights. The only reason I gave it a 4 star was because you are not following the planes exact location. Thank you developers for the app. A job well done.

I signed up for a 7 day trial of the Gold subscription. While using the app I noticed that a lot of information wasn't showing up on flights near my house, and the airport a few miles away didnt't show up. All of this info was on a free version of FlightAware. I decided to cancel the subscription in the google app store (as instructed in the app) but my credit card had already been charged even though the full 7 days was not up yet. I want a refund!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for reaching out to us. We are very sorry to hear you are facing this issue(s) with our app, please write more details to our technical support@fr24.com and we will do our best to solve it for you in the shortest time possible.

Looking forward to hear from you, have a lovely day!

Kind regards

scraped_reviews.content: App is fine and new features are attractive. I am another former pro version user and am very disappointed that the other app is at its end of life (even though it's working just fine, it will now be turned off.) I think turning off ads should be a one-time payment of something reasonable like we paid for pro on the other app. If the new app will last ten years, the cheapest subscription will cost you $100 for those years-for silver level, as gold is $350. Subscription model is awful compared.

A super cool app. If ATC is tracking it, they'll have it on the app, including info like the n-number, which you can use to look up all the public info on that individual plane or helicopter. If it's military, they'll have its callsign. I've also found it to be the best among all the other apps that do the same thing. If you like watching planes, If you've ever seen something unusual fly over and thought "wow! I wonder what that is!" With this, you'll be able to find out.

I used the app for about a year before upgrading to the gold plan. It's a wonderful application that's really opened up my eyes to how aviation surrounds us. I've never run into any serious bugs, with the exception of the Atlantic tracks occasionally not showing. Hardly a deal-breaker. All told, this is a phenomenal application that I've recommended to probably a dozen or so others.

If you love flights, or if you love tracking, you MIGHT LIKE this app. But, if you love tracking flights, you'll LOVE this app! And just pay the couple bucks to get rid of the ads. Why skimp on that in times of $6 gasoline? Useful for people who travel by air a lot, of course, but for those of us who just like flying machines, it's a super fun way to identify every contraption passing over our heads.

I really like both the app and the website! I live near about five different airports, and I really enjoy being able to see what's going on in the air above me. I got the cheaper of the two membership prices, which was something like $14 or $15 for a year and is definitely worth getting. It applies to both the app and website, gets rid of ads, and unlocks a bunch of neat features. I'd say the more expensive one is for pilots since it has some of the finer details. Overall, great app!

I love this app!!! I am a pilot for a global airline and discovered your app when I was waiting on arrival of my aircraft in Tokyo. I noticed the ground staff periodically checking their phones and when I asked they pointed out that they could watch the progress of the inbound flight as it taxied across the airport. This allowed them to more accurately deploy ramp personnel to park aircraft. I immediately downloaded it and have found it incredibly useful, both professionally & personally.

SILVER MEMBER Was previously a 5* app. However, recently, in the last month, the data screen (which shows all air traffic) seems to take much longer to load. The "spinning, data-loading" circle appears nearly constantly. The air picture does eventually load but continues to lag sporadically. It seems almost as if there's a need to "clear cache" but I'm not sure if that's even possible. I've not made any changes/modifications to my device (Samsung S21), so I'm pretty sure it's not me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear about your experience. Please email us more details to support@fr24.com and we'll assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Very disappointed that an App that I paid for just one day quits working forever. That is like a car manufacturer telling you "sorry your car is 10 years old and you'll need to buy a new one. We've disabled it" I've been using the paid Pro version since it originally came out and probably would have supported the move if given the choice. But not when its forced.

title: Melody Beat - Offline Music
description:
🎵 Melody Beat: Your Ultimate Offline Music Experience 🎵
Melody Beat is an offline music player application designed for playback of locally stored audio files.

🎧 Universal Format Support
Support MP3, FLAC, WAV, AAC, and 30+ formats with lossless quality, no conversion needed.

📂 Smart Library Management
Automatically organizes your music by artist, album, genre, or folder. Genre Search effortlessly with quick filters. Lyrics support included, even without the internet.

🎛️ Equalizer & Sound Customization
Personalize your sound with professional equalizer, bass boost, virtualizer, and pre-set modes for Pop, Rock, Jazz, Classical, and more.

🔁 Background & Lockscreen Playback
Control music directly from your notification bar or lockscreen. Perfect for workouts, commutes, or just saving battery.

🌍 Perfect for Every Scenario
- Travelers: Pre-download albums and playlists before flights.
- Gym Listeners: Streamless workouts with offline tracks that match your pace.No buffering. No interruptions.
- Daily Commuters: Plays smoothly in subways or low-signal areas.
- Privacy Users: All files stored locally. No cloud, no data tracking.

🔒 Privacy-First & User-Centric Design
- No Subscriptions: Pure music experience with zero hidden costs.
- Local-Only Storage: We don’t access, store, or share your music files. Your data is yours—always.
- Intuitive Interface: a clutter-free layout make navigation effortless for all users.

 🎶Made for music lovers, by music lovers. 
Updated Regularly – We are always improving. Expect new features, better performance, and even smoother playback.

⚙️ Required Permissions
FOREGROUND_SERVICE_MEDIA_PLAYBACK / FOREGROUND_SERVICE_SPECIAL_USE
This permission facilitates core functionality including,

Uninterrupted Playback: Listen to your music continuously in the background, without being stopped by your device's battery or memory optimization.
Convenient Controls: Manage your music directly from a persistent notification on your lock screen and notification bar. Easily play, pause, skip tracks, and adjust volume with a single tap.
Offline Access: Quickly scan and sync your local music library for instant, offline access to all your songs.

Elevate your listening experience with our professional music player. Enjoy your favorite music without interruption, even when you switch to other apps or turn off your screen.

🔥 Get It Now & Feel the Beat – Offline! 🔥

scraped_reviews.content: Misleading I've just opened the app and the ads appear
l like this positive impart sound editor like
Splendid. I'm impressed more than what I thought. It's worth the hype
experience was adorable 😍loved it
Good music player
the advertise no ads and when I open the app I get ads 😞
Dami parin Advertising... ☹️
she's good

title: PBS KIDS Games App
description:
The PBS KIDS Games app makes learning fun and safe with educational games for kids featuring favorites like Daniel Tiger, Wild Kratts, Lyla in the Loop, and more! Your child can play and learn with 250+ free educational games designed just for them!

Play and learn with PBS KIDS in English and Spanish with favorites like Alma, Rosie, and more. Download fun games for kids and play from the safety of your home or anywhere to keep the fun going offline.

Your child will learn and play in a safe, kid friendly interface, making preschool, kindergarten, and early elementary education fun and easy. Start your child’s learning adventure today!

SAFE GAMES DESIGNED FOR KIDS
* PBS KIDS Games provides a safe, kid friendly playing experience for your child or toddler
* Play mini games that boost imagination and allow kids to learn with beloved PBS KIDS characters

PLAY GAMES OFFLINE
* Download fun kids games and play offline!
* Kids can easily browse and play at home, on the road, or anywhere
* Download games to keep learning on the go

LEARNING GAMES FOR GRADE SCHOOL EDUCATION
* 250+ FREE curriculum-based games for kids ages 2-8
* Encourage early learning with educational games for kids with different school subjects
* Explore mazes, puzzles, play dress-up, coloring, and more
* Preschool and kindergarten games
* Math games
* Science games
* Reading games
* Art games
* And more!

NEW GAMES ADDED WEEKLY
* Kids will learn and have fun with new games added frequently
* Play new games with accessibility features to enhance the fun!
* Build STEM skills with science, engineering, and math puzzles
* Play games geared to help with social concepts like kindness, mindfulness, and emotions
* Games and activities for kids that can foster healthy habits by learning daily routines
* Spark creativity and imagination with art games

PLAY GAMES FROM PBS KIDS SHOWS
* Daniel Tiger’s Neighborhood
* Wild Kratts
* Lyla in the Loop
* Work It Out Wombats!
* Rosie’s Rules
* Alma’s Way
* Donkey Hodie
* Odd Squad
* Pinkalicious & Peterrific
* Arthur
* Elinor Wonders Why
* Let’s go Luna
* Xavier Riddle and the Secret Museum
* Scribbles and Ink
* Clifford
* Molly of Denali
* Sesame Street
* Nature Cat

PLAY IN ENGLISH OR SPANISH
* Bilingual kids will enjoy playing with Alma, Rosie, and more in English and Spanish
* Spanish speakers can play 17 educational games

PARENT RESOURCES
* Manage the app’s device storage for offline fun
* Download related PBS KIDS apps to expand your child’s learning
* Learn more about PBS TV shows, such as intended age and learning goals
* Find your local PBS KIDS station schedule

Play fun educational games and join your kids on a learning adventure alongside their favorite PBS KIDS characters with the PBS KIDS Games app!

Download PBS KIDS Games and start learning today!

ABOUT PBS KIDS
PBS KIDS, the number one educational media brand for kids, offers all children the opportunity to explore new ideas and new worlds through television, digital platforms, and community-based programs. PBS KIDS Games is a key part of PBS KIDS’ commitment to making a positive impact on the lives of children through curriculum-based media—wherever kids are. More free PBS KIDS games are also available online at pbskids.org/games. You can support PBS KIDS by downloading other PBS KIDS apps in the Google Play Store.

AWARDS
* Kidscreen Awards (2024): Best Game App – Branded, Digital, Preschool
* Webby Winner and Webby People’s Voice Winner (2023)
* Kidscreen Award Winner (2021 and 2022): Preschool - Best Game App
* Parents' Choice Recommended Mobile App (2017)

PRIVACY
Across all media platforms, PBS KIDS is committed to creating a safe and secure environment for children and families and being transparent about what information is collected from users. To learn more about PBS KIDS’ privacy policy, visit pbskids.org/privacy.
